text: Until recently, I had actually only been to Mercy for emergency room visits.  I am afraid to say, there have been more than a few of them.  Luckily, not all were mine.  They were however at least kept to the family - it is not like I am picking up people off the street and taking them to the emergency room, at Mercy or elsewhere.On this visit, I had to get some lab work.  Now I was never a fan of labs.  The mad scientist lab on Movie Macabre, perhaps.  But the type of lab you would have to do in biology?  I was too busy creating (and yes, throwing) spitballs across the room.  Still not the right kind of lab, yet I hope you get the idea how I am not a fan.The visit starts with the parking.  Mercy has never been strong here - they excel in friendliness, not in convenience.  For the emergency room, you get a nice - almost cozy - parking lot.  For the main entrance, parking is decent, but not particularly close.  Luckily, I scored a ride from some guy in a golf cart.  I am lucky that he did not seem to be a fan of Movie Macabre.  At least, if he is, he was working, and did not have time to 'cart' me to the woods.  Had he done so, I was at least close by - and how far can a golf cart really get before it dies from lack of juice?Once inside, the main entrance has been redone.  Completely.  It is really quite impressive.  Unfortunately, they have to pay for all of that, and what should be a really simple process of sticking you becomes a rather tedious check-in (including a wristband), a journey to another floor, and waiting, waiting and waiting some more.Finally I give just two tiny vials of blood and get to leave, without so much as the courtesy of a reach around (or even a ride back to the car via the golf cart).  Then I get the bill.  Lovely.  No wonder they could afford all that remodeling.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Carolinas Medical Center-Mercy

text: I think they keep making up words for doctors.  Who ever heard of an "endodontist" when they were growing up?  You just had a "doctor" and a "dentist"?  But I digress.When one of our sons needed to have a root canal, they sent us to the endodontist, and while I have no idea if there are many of them in the area, this is where we ended up.  (We have since found out that there is at least one other, since we have now been there too!)The office is pretty nice - I would imagine it's because of the prices.  Root canals aren't cheap.  The good thing is that rather than being in some dungeon while they dig at your teeth they let you look out a nice big window into the parking lot.  Unfortunately that means that people could look at you too - might be nice if they changed that.Anyway, the staff was very nice, and they took care of things very quickly, it all seems to be doing very well.  I just hope we don't have to see them again soon!
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: South Charlotte Endodontics

text: Finding a dentist can be quite a chore.  Sure, they are all over the place, but do you pull into the first one you find?  Unlike fast food, where you will probably be okay if you get a sub-par burger, you may want to do your best to make sure you get a good one when it comes to your teeth.Unfortunately there is no really good system.  Most of us look for a decent office, find a solid web page, depend on suggestions from our insurance carrier or ask our friends for ideas.  We might even ask people on the web!  And then we pull into the most convenient place anyway because we have put it off for so long we really have little other choice - and then generally pull out unhappy.  Heh.  I said "pull out".So when we relocated to Mint Hill, we were naturally inundated with flyers from just about every dentist in the area.  Which is to say, three of them.  As my wife hates dentists - I mean really hates dentists - I figured I would be the first to check him out, and I was pleasantly surprised.  The receptionist is very sweet, even offering to check into our insurance before we even arrive (of course, that helps them as much as it does us), and the waiting room is incredibly welcoming, and especially so for a dentist.Office hours are great - they are closed on Mondays, but they make up for it by being open later on other days and even on Saturdays!  The actual work rooms are almost as nice as the waiting room, and you even score a television of your very own, but because this is a small practice, you really get very little time to check anything out on the tube since they work so quickly.  I was unable to even locate the Spice Channel.I only hesitate to give a fifth star for two reasons.  One is that I have no skill as a dentist myself, so I am unable to tell if Dr. Park is really that talented or just good at making you feel like he knows what he is doing.  Now I could go all Steve Martin a la Little Shop of Horrors, but that really would not help me rate Dr. Park, which is the important part in judging (even though it may be fun as a second career).  Two is that, like Mike B., rating a dentist that high is really hard to do.
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Park Dental

text: This place is a hospital.  And then some.  It seems like they are always adding onto the monstrosity that is already there with another wing or deck or something.  But it's awfully nice, with a great staff and excellent response to your every question.  Unlike some other hospitals in the area (cough-Presbyterian-cough), they actually seem to care about getting you taken care of, and making sure that not only the patient but the family is attended to as well.Don't get me wrong - I'm sure that they are collecting some monumental coin in the process, but they certainly seem to be happy while doing it.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Carolinas Medical Center

text: After many (many) moons on this planet, and a good number of them in Charlotte without hearing so much as a peep about these people calling themselves Endodontists, I have now had the pleasure of visiting two.  Not for me, luckily, but that is a story for another time.Our last trip was not bad, it was just with another insurance company, which means that this referral took us to another location.  The joys of the world we live in.I will say that one of those joys is seeing how these bills pay for such nice offices.  Dr. Patel has a sweet layout, which is good since he is offering the service of digging deep into the roots of your teeth.  And the man himself is quite personable as well - something you cannot say about most doctors in general.The only downside is that the place is difficult to find.  Our son suggests they put a giant tooth on the building or something, because even knowing the address, looking it up online and having directions did not help much.  Still, once there everything was smooth sailing.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Patel Dr Anish

text: Unlike the main campus near downtown, this facility is actually very nice.  And they are generally pretty competent, and almost always well-staffed.  I'll also say that the emergency room is typically slow as molasses, unless you have a life-threatening situation, however.Perhaps those who have seen short lines have a more serious complication than we did, and I'll also say that everyone has been very nice during the process, but it's not unusual to have to wait for a very long time if you aren't bleeding profusely or about to have some serious complication.  Still, it's better to do it here than at the main campus.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Novant Health Matthews Medical Center

text: I am fortunate enough to not - personally - have a need for glasses.  But members of the family do, and Lenscrafters is even conveniently located right next to the eye doctor.  As a bonus, they have a secret passage in between the two, so that you can sneak between the two stores, in case you are worried about someone catching you picking up a pair of glasses when you would rather no one see you.Frankly I think that they need this sort of thing for when you are somewhere other than the eye doctor, but hey, whatever floats your boat.The staff at Lenscrafters is actually really nice, and other than the fact that there are so many frames to choose from, even in the kids' section (or especially in the kids' section), it's a nice facility.  Pick out the glasses, go shopping around the rest of the mall or pick up a bite, come back in an hour or so, and they will have you ready to go - even filing your insurance for you.  Nice if it's the sort of thing you need to do.
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 3, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True}
name: LensCrafters

text: CMC University is another of those places that I pass a lot.  Not as much as some of the others on the list this week, because I am not in the University area all that much these days.  But I do find myself going past them quite often.  Generally you will not even notice that you are going past a hospital.So it was that we ended up in the emergency room one night (as we so often do).  As emergency rooms go, theirs is top-notch.  Not one of those cramped places where you feel like one of you are about to be booked into a holding cell, here it is actually quite nice, all things considered.  And even better, you will find that you are not waiting all night to get into a room and treated - even if you are just being checked out after a (relatively) minor car wreck.There have been times at other facilities that even getting into a room has taken the better part of a night.  At CMC University, checking in, getting a room and getting discharged was all done in just a couple of hours.  Sweet.  I would probably suggest avoiding the situation altogether if you can, but if you are unable to do so, it is definitely a decent choice.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Carolinas Medical Center-University

text: Now I know that I'm not only getting old, but I'm going blind as well.  The bi-annual (ish) trip to the eye doctor resulted not in the typical in-and-out (and not the hamburger), but in a drawn-out, lengthy "1 or 2", "3 or 4" session, as if I was stuck in the midst of filming for a Deck the Halls sequel.  At least it is the holiday season.I can't blame it on Dr. Musler either that I am getting older or going blind, so I suppose I have to rate their service, and on that front, they are decent.  Generally having quite good eyesight - until now, at least - I can't compare much, but they do a serviceable job getting you in and out, even if they aren't overly friendly or if there is much to do for kids while they wait impatiently.Where I will give them the nod is that they take our insurance (generously provided at no small cost by our employer), where many others in town don't.  I can't explain why eye doctors wouldn't take vision insurance, but hey - we pay for it, it is nice that at least someone takes it.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Jeffrey I. Musler & Associates

text: Getting stuck for tests really stinks. Having to do it in the doctor's office is bad enough. Having to drive - or walk, if you are close enough to do so - to another place entirely is like a slap in the face.But the staff here is friendly, if perhaps a bit overwhelmed at times. They process your paperwork, like every other medical place on the planet, you sit, they stick you, take your blood (as much as is needed), and you are on your way, sooner or later.
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Quest Diagnostics Incorporated

text: So I had to leave my old dentist due to several visits and work on my teeth that continue to get worse.....searching Yelp I found Dr. Simmons Boyd.  With some great reviews and close to the center city, I decided to check them out.Since the year is coming to a close I needed to use my yearly check up.  I called and they actually had an available spot within a few days....nice!So I showed up 15 minutes early and filled out the standard paper work.   The front desk staff are nice...and funny.Next I got inspected and my xrays done.............now this was a nice change.  My father was a dentist and he used film, but in this day and age they use digital xrays, so they are done and show up on a monitor above the chair in almost real time?  Next came my cleaning and then the final exam from Dr. Simmons Boyd.  She was nice, very helpful with all my questions....and I had a lot due to my previous work that went bad now I have to have crowns, so that is some major work.They take....what I call unique types of payment (GE Capital has a credit card - non Visa that they take .....By the Way, my eye doctor DOES NOT TAKE IT....rumpf!)  So good for Dr. Simmons Boyd!!I checked out with my free toothpaste and tooth brush!I am looking forward to this dental relationship for some time.
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Sandra Simmons-Boyd, DDS

text: So the story goes....I use to work in Charlotte...like 5 years ago...and there was this eye doctor who fitted me for glasses and had a lot of great brands to choose from as well as just great eye side manner...I mean there weren't any beds like regular doctors you know *grin*.And I moved away to the great white north.....Then fast forward to the present...here and now....and I've moved back to Charlotte I think, hey...I'll go back to that great eye doc......but when I did I got fitted with lenses that were not what I wanted or asked for and they changed them back...but didn't refund for their mistake...the next year I got fitted for another set of lenses and this time they made the prescription so powerful I had to have my computer screen about 12 inches from my face to get it in focus??? Not to mention the little session in the examination room with Dr. Moore as he told me how Obama had screwed up the Health care system, blah...blah..blah....if I wanted that kind of political commentary I know of 1 one evil news station and plenty of people who can do the same kind of complaining....when I go to the eye doctor I want to talk about my eyes.....not how his retirement fortune will loose money because of the Government....I think I'll shop around with my health care dollars in 2011...and Dr. Moore won't be on the list....and his retirement fortune won't be impacted by Obama...but rather me *wink*.

text: So I thought I broke a leg...go figure.  After 1 visit to the doctor I was referred to OrthoCarolina to make a final determination.  After getting an MRI, the results were sent to OthorCarolina and I was schedule an appointment.Now I was told by my regular doctor they were not going to take an X-ray as the MRI would provide the best detail to determine the real damage.I waited for 45 minutes for my appointment, which I was 15 minutes early for and then another 10 minutes in the examining room.  First an intern came in and asked questions....touched my leg, tested it, etc....then another 5 minutes waiting when the real doctor came in (names withheld to protect the innocent).  He asked the same questions and did the same test only to tell me they were going to take an X-ray.................I said no.................they said they wanted to be sure they covered everything................I said I had just paid A LOT of money just with my deductible (6 times the normal co-pay) and that my doctor along with the MRI folks indicated an X-ray would not show the detail needed for this diagnosis.................they said it was important to get the X-ray.................again I said no or prove to me why the MRI was not providing the necessary information needed.........needless to say they could not come up with an answer.  I acquiesce and did it anyway.......SOAPBOX MOMENT......this is probably why Health Care is in the shape it is in...........to quote a friend...."left hand, say hello to the right hand."I was given medication and a follow up appointment........let's hope it goes better than this one?
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: OrthoCarolina

text: So after another start of another bootcamp my shoulders just said "heck no" at work later that day...so I got online and looked through Yelp to help me find a place to unwind these muscles of mine.Faith had been writing reviews on this place for a while and they seem to make her happy, though it wasn't toxins that were my concern, but rather this knot of a muscle in the middle of my back that was SCREAMING.So I made an appointment the same day I called and got an appointment.  When I got there I filled out some standard paperwork and in one section it asked how I wanted to feel when it was over...I wrote,"broken AND renewed."  With a deep tissue as my selected massage I felt that the former was very achievable due to my condition.I signed up for the 1.5 hour one and grunted and winced the entire time.  Though I felt like hell afterwards, 2 days later I was back to normal and definitely feel it was directly related to my massage.  I'll be back soon as I saw they have discounted bulk packages.

text: I used the facilities at the YMCA a few times during my recent stay at the Hilton next door. I appreciated that hotel guests got access to a full-sized gym instead of a dinky hotel gym. I found the layout of the YMCA to be cramped and a bit uncomfortable. Everything is so exposed and I prefer gyms with a few nooks and crannies where I can lay on the floor and exercise in semi-privacy.The hours make sense for the office environment but I really wish it would've stayed open later than 9pm.I found the cardio machines to be in excellent shape and I enjoyed watching Law & Order, SVU while sweating on the elliptical (go ahead, make fun of the fact that I like ellipticals).The best part of the YMCA is how clean it is. There is cleaning spray and a towel stationed at every machine and I noticed that people were very good about cleaning up after themselves.

text: I really like my other doctor. She was thorough, she was patient and she was very nice. She also did me a massive favor when I needed a "professional" reference a couple of years back. But she moved out to a practice in Monroe and I just can't drive an hour each way any more.The practice that she used to be with that I originally went to near Presbyterian has since moved here to Foxcroft, on Fairview near Colony in Southpark. They have a few doctors in this practice but it's not a massive office. I prefer that.I made my appointment and was seen on time. My new doctor was thorough and professional. The referral arrived in my email an hour after I left and the notification of my blood test results came back a few days letter. (Good stick for that, by the way. Very good phlebotomist.)I'll be officially changing to this doctor and this practice. Very good, I'm a fan!
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Novant Health Primary Care Foxcroft

text: Efficient service and a quality cleaning, DOC does the legwork in determining what's covered by insurance and what is not so that you can know what work might be up to you to pay for.I've been coming here for a while and been pleased with the work though I fortunately have not had to have anything major done. They have the solid technology like the panoramic xray doo-dad and also the one that plugs into the USB port of the computer for a low-dose bitewing. Awesome.I'll keep coming back!
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Dentistry of the Carolinas - Myers Park

text: Efficient and speedy. When it's a weekend and you don't feel like waiting until Monday to try and make an appointment to see your primary care physician, Urgent Care fills a niche.Coughing and wheezing and sniffling my way in, the clerk at the desk took my details and had me fill out a form. When I returned, she took my copay while I waited to see the doctor. About 20 minutes later, into the small room where I waited another few minutes before the doctor came in. He gave me a thorough exam and determined that I had a chest and nasal infection. A prescription later and a recommendation for bed rest (uh, no. travel instead), I was out the door.Would I return? Absolutely. Good stuff!
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Urgent Care Centers Carolinas Healthcare System

text: When my optometrist moved to a practice that was not convenient for me, I checked around and decided on Horizon Eye Care. A larger practice with offices around Charlotte should work better for me and my travel schedule. So I called and was able to make an appointment for the same day. I was quoted a price for the eye exam, plus an additional cost for a contact lens exam.The Cotswold location is a free standing building with a large parking lot. The waiting room is large. I'd expect that with 8 or 9 doctors on call and 26 exam rooms. This is a large practice.My name was called shortly after time (I had a lot of paperwork!) and I was brought back to an exam room where my eyes were checked, my pupils were dilated and I was given a thorough check by at least two eye professionals before I was done. And then, I was brought over to the contact lens area where I got another brief exam, I was fitted for lenses (I had brought my old box with me) and I was given a fresh pair to "try on."In the end, nearly 90 minutes later, the price was different than what I was quoted. More for the initial exam and less for the contact lenses.  Weird, but I won't argue with a lower cost.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Horizon Eye Care

text: A dentist that's open on a Friday? Unheard of! But there's this Dentistry of the Carolinas office which is one of their branches in the Charlotte area and they were able to see me for a semi-emergency visit. Good service, quality dentistry, and they're open on Friday. What's not to love??
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Dentistry of the Carolinas - SouthPark

text: A family member recently had a knee replacement here. The surgery was a complete success, though I'm not sure how much of that is the credit of the hospital and how much is the surgeon who did the work.Hospital staff was good, but there were a couple things that need improvement.- The hospital asked us to be there at 11:30 for a 2:30 surgery time - three hours of sitting around and waiting made the patient so anxious that a sedative was required.- The pull cord for the light over the bed was broken - there was no way to turn off the light at night. I had to bring an eye mask.- The wifi wouldn't connect to the Internet.- The discharge process took four hours from the time the doctor told us that we'd be discharged until the discharge nurse arrived. And then another half hour of waiting for someone to "drive" the wheelchair to the lobby.PlusesPrivate roomInternet, if it workedGood parking in the nearby deckFour stars. I hope we don't need to be back.
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Presbyterian Orthopaedic Hospital

text: I've been coming here for a couple of years but now this optometrist business is a business on Yelp. So here we go.The doctor who examined my eyes was unusually thorough and not rushed today. We had a good appointment where I mentioned that I was tired of the reading glasses. She suggested we try a monovision set up where one eye has a contact lens for "close up" vision and the other eye is set for "distance" viewing. I was a little skeptical but it's been almost a week now and it seems to be working okay. I can see my computer screen just fine (and write Yelp reviews!) and I can drive my car just fine too (and drive to new Yelp businesses!). I have no complaints.The office is in the Vision Center of the Walmart.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Tryon Eye Associates

text: My first complaint is that the parking for the Emergency Room (sorry, they call it "Emergency Department") is on the opposite side of the hospital, over by the main entrance. At the moment, that road is torn up by the lovely folks in the City of Charlotte, so you'll want to go -clockwise- around the hospital after you arrive at the ER thinking there will be parking nearby. But while the main entrance is on the opposite side from the ER, the signage through the ground floor hallways between them is excellent.Inside, there was what seemed like a very long wait to be in pain but when you're not bleeding or in immediate danger after your triage, even if you've been brought in by ambulance, then you're still going to wait for the more serious patients. That's okay in hindsight, but it still sucks to be hurting and waiting an hour for a bed in the ER.The staff that helped us was excellent. Attentive and not condescending, they explained what they were doing, what was going to happen and (more or less) how long things were going to take.And there's a free wireless guest network so that you can Google everything they say to confirm!While it was a good experience, I sure hope not to go back.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Novant Health Presybeterian Medical Center

text: Sometimes people get sick. Sometimes they get sick when they're away from their home and their usual doctor. When that happens, Urgent Care facilities fill the need. Presbyterian was there at 6:00 on a Saturday when others were closed. I brought my mom here with an earache.Helped by a check-in clerk, we got to sit for a long while in a waiting room with an overly loud TV and several people simply glued to the TV. I suppose I can't really point fingers since I was glued to my phone and their free wi-fi.I can't give you a specific review of the doctor or the care once we were called, since I waited while my mom went back. It was about another 45 minutes before she was released (discharged?).On the weekends, parking is a piece of cake. The parking deck is almost completely empty. During the week, you may end up on one of the higher levels.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Presbyterian Urgent Care-Randolph

text: Great alternative healthcare/medicine service in the Queen City! $20-$40 gets you a treatment! The acupuncturist was really nice and gentle, offering a warm welcome as I entered the office.Bring your ipod and headphones. Although they do a very nice job of keeping it quiet, you still hear the occasional shifting of clients, sweeping of floor, or whispering. They keep it at 74 degrees and it is comfortable, but if you get chilled easily (if your Qi isn't balanced yet), then bring something light to put over you. It was a lot more organized, clean, and cozy than I had anticipated. The bathrooms are located down the hall, outside of the suite and are very clean and modern. The ambiance is very soothing and inviting! I thought it would be a bit strange reclining in a large room with strangers while needles are sticking out of my body, but interestingly enough it wasn't weird at all.Bring cash, you can also ask for a receipt to use your flex spending account. Register online, do the paperwork at home and save $15. I'm happy that they opened! I really like how they offer affordable alternative healthcare for everyone on every budget. Give it a try if you haven't done acupuncture yet! You may need to commit to 5 treatments or so to see a difference (at least that is what I'm going to do). If you have questions, they offer a Thursday session for you to get your questions answered since you really cannot get into details of your treatment at the time of service (do to the community setting). At the end of the treatment, I found that I like the community setting because it's another experience for you and a friend/spouse/partner to share!
address: NC Music Factory, 1000 Seaboard St, Ste B12
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Charlotte Community Acupuncture

text: Love massages. Despise memberships...especially when they try to convince you directly after your massage when you're still in the tranquil-not-want-to-think mode. At least the person trying to sign me up was kind and not too forceful.  The space itself is in a great location. It's well decorated to promote calm. The massage therapist was good, not the best, but good to where I felt a bit more relaxed that when I got there. They offer a great introductory special of $39. If you are all knotted up and could use a good massage, give them a call. Just be prepared for someone to really talk up signing up for a monthly membership at the end.
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Massage Envy - South Park

text: Massage Heights has a fantastic introductory price for your very first session. It is only $39.99 without taxes or tip. I even found a coupon in one of those mailers for a free "elevation," which is aromatherapy, a foot exfoliant and massage, or a hot towel and face massage.I was able to get a same-day appointment (great for the impulsive!). Getting your first massage from a new massage therapist is like going to a new hair stylist. I've been getting monthly massages for years and I was so sad to leave my massage therapist behind when I moved to Charlotte. I hope to find someone as good.The facility is in a shopping strip-mall area and the front is all windows so anyone can see in the immediate waiting area. However, once you step through the doors, the atmosphere is very classy, the aroma is relaxing, and the front desk receptionist is very friendly and calm. Once you check in and fill out a client form, you go through double-doors and go to a quiet and secluded waiting area for your massage therapist. The music was relaxing. Christopher was my massage therapist and was very friendly. There were times during the massage that he would inform me of what he was doing or going to do next (perhaps due to being a first time guest). At times his movements were too fast and seemed to be a bit rough; however, he was open to any feedback I gave. There were times when I felt relaxed because there was a rhythm to the massage and other times I wasn't able to drift off because of the lack of rhythm. I think overall it was good and I left feeling better.At the end, you return to the front to pay. They offer a membership package which discounts the price of a monthly massage, but you do not pay a membership fee. I did not feel pressure to make a decision.I was impressed with the facility and the variety of massages and services they offer. I plan on trying a few other places to compare before I settle down with a new massage therapist.
address: 324 S Sharon Amity Rd, Ste B
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Massage Heights Cotswold

text: This massage place churns out happy customers. They are super busy...all the time. If you are looking to get a same-day booking, don't get your hopes up (especially if you have a particular person in mind). Perhaps they are so busy because they have been running a Groupon deal for the past few months and it's the holidays. In any case, once I was able to get scheduled, the massage itself was very good. I had Alisha and she was good and professional. My husband got a massage by Regina and really thought she was good too. Parking can be tricky depending on what time of the day you arrive. If you are anytime near the lunch hour, plan ahead and allow more time to find a parking spot. You'll really enjoy a massage after getting stressed out just getting there.  When you call, the front desk attendants are super nice. The main weird thing is how they designed the waiting area. It's just weird and awkward. You will pleasantly enjoy seeing people squeeze through an area and stand directly in front of another patron sitting in a chair. The person in the chair has to awkwardly twist and turn to not see someone else's backside right in front of them. The waiting area is just a tight fit and fills up quickly with people waiting to be seen and with mellowed out patrons coming out. Search for their Groupon and enjoy some self-care time.
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Elements Massage

text: I was very impressed with the professionalism, cleanliness, and personal touch I found here at Ageless Remedies. It's tucked in the corner of the Morrison Shops (same area as the Harris Teeter) and from the outside, I thought nothing of it. However, once inside I was greeted by a very friendly staff, offered a beverage, and some dark chocolate treats. The waiting area only has 2 chairs, so plan on standing if more than 2 are waiting. They also have a thorough supply of cosmetic items: lotions, make-up, and even some lovely candles in their retail section.They have 2 consultation rooms and it seemed like plenty of rooms for your non-surgical procedures. They offer complimentary consultations, which I greatly appreciate. The staff and physician were very friendly, super informative, and they truly believed in what they do and conveyed realistic results and had a photo book to prove the before and after treatments. They offer a wide selection of services: waxing, laser hair removal, facials. After spending almost a full hour with them, I wanted to sign up for everything they had to offer!They are kind of pricey, but it seems like you get what you pay for in a very professional and good kind of way. I'll be saving my pennies to try one or two of their services and products!
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 3, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Ageless Remedies SouthPark

text: It's about that time to award another star! Eden Therapy is my monthly stop for self-care. I love that I can count on consistency here.They have gift certificates available and with the holidays around the corner this is the perfect gift! Typically they can schedule you within a day or two. I treated my mother-in-law to a massage when she visited last month and I scored many bonus points in her book! Take it from me, everyone can benefit from an hour of pampering!

name: Eden Therapy & Massage

text: Friendly and helpful...even when you almost faint during routine blood work. Yep. Thankfully there was an empty examination room nearby and available so I could lay around until I felt less fainty.Each time I've been here, they stick to the schedule. I don't feel rushed when I ask Dr. Ibe questions. She is friendly and patient. I appreciate that! During times when I need to get in immediately, if I can't see Dr. Ibe, I see her PA. They can get you the same day or within a couples days, which I think is great. Hopefully I won't have to go back any time soon, but if I do, I'm confident I won't have any problems getting in.
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Cotswold Medical Clinic

text: Had your 6 month check up lately? My mom owes me $5...no cavities! Awesome. This office location is in SouthPark (they have others in Charlotte). They take most, if not all, insurance. Office staff are friendly and efficient. By the time you check in to the time you leave (as long as there aren't any issues) is under an hour. If you need to have your records transferred to another office (e.g., oral surgeon) they are happy to do so and they follow up with them as well. Also, the dental hygienists are "gentle" on your gums. They also give you their version of sunglasses so that way you can protect your eyes (from the occasional water spray), which I appreciate since I don't normally wear waterproof mascara. I don't mind going to the dentist and in fact, I love getting the "party favor" bag filled with a new toothbrush, toothpaste, and floss at the end of each visit.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: University Dental Associates South Park

text: You cannot miss Zen Massage Center in Dilworth...the neon orange houses scream, "Here we are!" I called for two appointments for the same time, but not a couple's massage (I don't enjoy those) and was able to book an appointment within 24 hours for myself and my husband. The staff are friendly and give a warm greeting upon arrival. The atmosphere is nice and they did a good job turning homes into the business. They have fountains and music in each room to lessen any outside noise. My massage therapist did an okay job, but I was disappointed because I didn't leave feeling like I got tension or stress released. Usually when I get good massages I feel like I am on cloud-nine or in a trance. Unfortunately, after I left the only trace of me getting a massage was the oily feel on my skin. My husband said that the woman that worked on him did a fine job. The price is $39.95 per 50 minute Swedish massage. In my case, I got what I paid for...an okay massage that didn't "do-the-trick." They accept credit cards and you can add gratuity to the charge (that may have changed since the previous review). They also suggest $10-$20 tip for the 50 minute session.
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Zen Massage Charlotte

text: Well oiled machine! From the time you call in to book your appointment, to the time you check in, until the moment you leave, they have you going from one station to the next. Typically my hair appointments can last up to 4 hours, but the last two times I went here, I got out with a good looking 'do in 2.5!I got my color from Autumn and cut from Jesse. Both gave me what I wanted and I felt they stayed true to the photo I showed them. Each one specializes in a particular area and it shows that they do it well. I loved getting a hot towel wrapped around my head after the wash! Bliss.The salon itself is high class with a modern touch in a very cool converted fire house (pole still there). Upstairs you'll find the nail tech, massage therapists, and aestheticians. You could spend an entire day here getting pampered...however, you will pay a very pretty penny to do so...so save those pennies to pamper yourself, you'll be glad you did!
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': True}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'GoodForKids': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Re Salon and Med Spa

text: Although much farther away from my work or home than my previous doctor in Charlotte, the extra drive to Northwest Family Physicians is always worth it (if I leave on time and don't get caught behind any school buses on the way).  Dr. William Larsen was recommended to me and I'm glad I switched my primary care to him.  I receive such great care from Dr. Larsen and I feel comfortable talking to him openly and honestly.  Best of all, he doesn't rush in and out of the room.  He takes the time to sit and listen to you to understand everything that may be affecting your current symptoms.  The staff has always been great, too.  Doctor appointments are usually last-minute things for me (because I'm dying or something) and they can always get me in when it's convenient for ME.  I appreciate that and that says a lot about their service.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Northwest Family Physicians

text: We booked a couples' hot stone massage at Eden and weren't disappointed.  Upon entering the store (for lack of a better word), it immediately felt comforting.  The store uses a relaxing, modern green color throughout, accented by dark wood and brown paint.  We were immediately greeted and asked to fill out an informational form in their  spotless lobby.  Soon, we were led back to a low-lit room and asked to disrobe for the massage.   After comfortably (and warmly underneath the covers) situated on the massage beds, the massage therapists returned.  I had George as my massage therapist and would highly recommend him.  The heat from the hot stones and the techniques he used worked out the tense muscles in my back and neck.  I felt so relaxed (and almost jello-like) after the massage that I didn't want to leave.  Or...I wanted to leave to go home and go right to bed.  Getting massages are definitely luxuries...but sometimes you really need them.  It's good to treat yourself.  Like milk, it does a body good.  I had a much more relaxed, calmer attitude the rest of the day and look forward to treating myself to another hour of pampering one day soon.
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': True, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': False, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': True}
name: Eden Therapy & Massage

text: Since moving to Charlotte four years ago, I've made Williams & Drake Dentistry (formerly Stuart Williams, DDS) my home for teeth care.  Prices are comparable to other dentist offices, the equipment is new and top-of-the-line, the lobby decor is ultra modern, and the people (including both Drs. Williams and Drake) are super-friendly (not in a Batman or WonderTwins sort of way, but very amicable).  Best of all, when you're seated in your chair, you get a flatscreen TV put right in front of your face to distract you.  I get to pick up "Good Morning, America" where I left off from home!  My only complaint would be their charging practice.  I get charged more than my insurance co-pay and then have to wait for a refund check mailed to me once they receive payment from my insurance company.  Weird, but hopefully that quirky detail will be worked out soon.Anywho, this office is top-notch and I've recommended it several times to anyone looking for a dentist.
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Drake Dentistry of Charlotte

text: I used to live in Orlando, and every year I would go to one of the spas at a Disney Resort on my birthday as a special treat.  I worked for Disney at the time and received a discount.  After moving to Charlotte, I decided to give Zen Massage a try.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money and I was a little suspicious about the $39.95 per hour asking price.  It was at least 1/2 the price that I was used to paying (with a discount!), so I figured there were extra hidden charges that I'd discover once I got there.   NOPE!    No membership (like some massage places in Charlotte)...and no additional cost (unless you want a different type of massage or to add aromatherapy).   What a bargain!  And the massage itself was everything I had hoped it would be.  VERY relaxing, quiet music, comfortable setting.  I felt no difference between the massage at Zen and the more expensive massages I've had.  I highly recommend this as a special treat for both men and women.  And not just for  birthdays!  You can't go wrong at the great prices offered!  Each room in this old house in historic Dilworth is a different massage room...and you can even do couples massages in a bigger room if you want.  You can't miss the big orange houses on East Blvd!  It's best to make reservations for the appointments.  And they take credit cards for payment...but don't forget to bring cash to tip your masseuse!
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': False, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Zen Massage Charlotte

text: With the closure of my previous dentist's office, I had to locate another (not an easy task).  Dental Connection popped up as a provider for my insurance, so I decided to give them a try after reading recent reviews and checking out their website.  [Note: Ignore the previous reviews on Yelp.  The dentists here now took over the practice about a year and a half ago, so the older reviews don't apply to them.]  Getting an appointment and checking in as a new patient was very easy (and a lot quicker than I had expected).  They had already done their homework with the information I provided over the phone.  My hygienist Melissa was very personable and did an exceptional job taking x-rays, cleaning my teeth, and setting me up as a new patient.  After she was done, Dr. Modlin ("Mike") introduced himself, and took the time to look over my chart, x-rays, and check my teeth.  He, too, was very friendly and personable.  I was given a clean bill of health, and I wasn't pressured into getting any unnecessary procedures done.   I felt confident in everyone that I spoke to at the office.  The office has modern equipment and has been recently remodeled/updated.  I look forward to returning every six months.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Dental Connection

text: In July, I had two CT Scans performed at Presbyterian Imaging Center on Randolph Rd.  I went first thing in the morning on both occasions and there was no one there other than the receptionist and the person running the machine.  Those particular staff were very welcoming and friendly and made the experiences a breeze.  I give them five stars.For the follow-up, I give Mecklenburg Radiology Associates one star.  Hence, my three-star rating.  I took the average.  Since my visits, I have received a multitude of paperwork, all of which carry varying amounts, information, etc.  I've requested twice now that they provide a detailed explanation of what bills cover what services and I've gotten no response other than a friendly letter from a collection agency.  Apparently, they expect me to send in sixteen different payments just on a whim, because they requested it, offering no explanation or detail of each amount.  So while I can recommend the staff at the Center, I can't recommend the follow-up or billing department.  They're basically useless.
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Mecklenburg Radiology Associates

text: I wholeheartedly agree with Mike K. - for your money, this is a great deal in Charlotte. The Dowd Y is a very nice gym that offers a bevy of group fitness classes, up to date (and always functioning) equipment and a super clean atmosphere. Why I love this Y in particular...the machines are always in service (and I've head that techs are out fixing them weekly if need be). They also do not allow any children under the age of 16 in the workout areas. Now, don't get me wrong, I love kids, just not when I'm trying to get my sweat on. As mentioned before, this Y offers so many great group classes. I'm a big fan of Total Strength, Pilates Mat and Kickboxing. I've also heard the Spin classes are great. I've tried Athletic Conditioning, and while it certainly is an awesome workout, make sure you're at least in decent shape before you partake in that class! It's a rough one. As other reviewers have noted, this gym can get packed especially after 5 pm during the weekdays. So be patient while parking. Some classes can get a bit crowded too, so keep that in mind when you're sprawling out your mat or equipment. I haven't had any issues with theft in the locker room, but I'm a big proponent of a big papa lock on my locker. For the money and the friendly service, the Dowd YMCA is a great deal for anyone looking to slim down or tone up.
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BikeParking': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Fitness & Instruction', 'Local Services', 'Health & Medical', 'Child Care & Day Care', 'Active Life', 'Gyms', 'Weight Loss Centers']
name: Dowd Branch YMCA

text: A good phlebotomist it hard to find. Seriously. Therefore, when I donate blood, I head over to this Red Cross on Park Road. Because, you guessed it, their phlebotomists (blood drawers) are top notch. You may think I'm being a bit facetious when I yammer on and on about their staff, but I'm not! Every time I've gone in here to donate, they are great - super friendly, funny and knowledgeable. They also play some great tunes in the background. The facilities are also pretty nice - plenty of testing/question rooms, comfy chairs and superb snacks. Yes, they have Nutter Butters. Scoooooore! And, honestly, every time I get my butt over here to donate blood they really do seem appreciative. I'm typically in and out with an hour - but if you're pressed for time, make sure you call and make an appointment. This is my go-to nonprofit to donate my precious O negative. Save three lives, score some tasty snacks and donate blood, people.
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
categories: ['Medical Centers', 'Local Services', 'Education', 'CPR Classes', 'Specialty Schools', 'Community Service/Non-Profit', 'Health & Medical', 'Professional Services', 'Employment Agencies', 'First Aid Classes', 'Blood & Plasma Donation Centers']
name: American Red Cross

text: My dental work surely sends at least one kid to college. Even though I brush 2-3x per day & floss daily, it is inevitable as I have crappy enamel. Therefore, when I choose a dentist I typically choose one for location, nice staff and the know how of effectively navigating through my expensive grill. I started going to this DentalWorks location a few years back as I worked down the road in Huntersville. And since then, I've been happy with my treatments here, as I continue to to back twice per year for cleanings and such. My absolute favorite dental tech is Kandiss - she's a sweetie and definitely takes time to explain what she's looking at, cleans with care and always has a smile on her face. Dr. Alwat always checks up on me after each cleaning and has also taken care of a few fillings and one crown. Yes, I'm a double princess, I actually have two crowns now. Hooray. While crowns and fillings aren't anywhere near fun, the staff at DentalWorks took good care of me for an affordable price (w/insurance). I have now gone through two cleanings/check ups without any further work needed, so obviously I'm doing something right! Also, make note that if you stay on schedule w/your cleanings, you'll get a free, personalized whitening kit with super strong whitening gel. Hey, sure, I'll whiten my teeth for free, thanks! Even though this location is a bit out of the way for me, I appreciate the staff and service here so I'll continue to go to DentalWorks!
address: 10011 Biddick Ln, Ste 140, Northcross Shopping Center
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: DentalWorks

text: For those who think yoga has to be super hot and full of fluid movement, get yourself over to Moga! This type of instruction is akin to making a perfect risotto...low and slow. And I mean that in the best possible way. I also like risotto. Just sayin'. The owners Emily and Beth are great athletes - CrossFit aficionados and runners extraordinaire. Thus, when you head into this gorgeous, light filled studio at Atherton Lofts, expect a class full of refreshing movements. The class I dropped in for was the "Refresh and Renew." This is not bust-your-ass yoga, this is stretch your super sore limbs and try to relax yoga. It's improve your mobility yoga. It's also worth noting that the instructors will focus on one anatomical body area each month - this month it's hips. These hips were grateful...and these hips don't lie, yo. The instruction is straightforward and lighthearted and very few (if any) Sanskrit terms are used...and, frankly, that's refreshing on its own. Adjustments via the instructors were on the light side, both in number and pressure, but I imagine this will develop as the student attends more classes. And as for accessories and materials to help you into the poses, Moga has access to a plethora of mats, blocks, straps, and blankets! New students can take advantage of a sweet class deal, so hop to it and get your Moga on. You too can feel stretchy like and limber after just a class or two!
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Moga

text: While the Dowd is less than 1.5 miles away from the Uptown location, I imagine this particular YMCA is super convenient to the folks who work Uptown. Yes, durr. But, I do prefer the Uptown Y over Gateway for a couple reasons....not only because its closer but...because:-This Y has a nice variety of mid-day group classes, granted they can be pretty crowded at times with all those bankers workin' up a sweat before they head back to work-There is a nice variety of weight equipment and cardio machines arranged in a half moon fashion around the basketball courts (these courts are nice, too)-If you're a swimmer, this is a convenient spot to get your laps done-And I just realized that there is a running track upstairs...who knew?!-Free parking in the Hilton garage - just make sure to park in the correct spots and validate your ticket on your way out of the gymSo, while I typically hit up the Dowd, the Uptown (Childress Klein) location is a nice option if I prefer to run to the gym or catch a specific group class. *FYI: If you're interested in the group yoga classes, go to the front desk first and get a pass. The actual yoga room is down the last elevator bank and through the glass doors. You need a pass to get through security.
address: 301 S College St, One Wells Fargo Center, Ste 200

text: Exhale Healing is now my go-to spot for a hurts-so-good massage. With the fab deal they're running through Yelp right now ($65 for 1.5 hour massage) I couldn't pass up an opportunity to try them out for some massage therapy.Conveniently located across from Park Rd. Shopping Center, Exhale Healing is four floors up in the brown brick building off of Park Rd. Easy peasy parking! When I walked into their suite, I was greeted by the smiling faces of Olga and Erin. Hubs wanted a relaxing Swedish massage and I was looking for more of a deep tissue, kick the crap out of my muscles kind of massage. I was placed with Erin and when we entered the massage room she evaluated my posture, spine and overall range of motion. Let me tell ya, 1.5 hours of myofascial release massage (deep tissue) is both fantastic and to-the-limit intense at the same time. I felt straighter, taller and more balanced overall. If you have a stiff back, soreness or just need a relaxing massage of any kind, check out Exhale Healing. Their massage therapists are top notch and they definitely offer a great value for any length of time!
attributes: {'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}}
name: Exhale Healing

text: Gorgeous space, talented staff...what more could you ask for in a salon & spa? Jesse is the man when it comes to haircuts. While he's adept at all lengths, it's the short lengths where he really shines. He updated my cut to an edgier version that I'm loving. As for color, I visited Autumn for a partial highlight...and was very impressed she focuses on balayage as her technique. The application looks soft and natural and I loved the gloss she applied afterwards. Next time I'll be going a bit darker, though. Price points for both cut and color are mid-range to a touch above.  The space is a stunning, remodeled fire house full of really friendly, educated staff. Whether you're looking for a salon service, facial, mani/pedi or a more medically backed option like fillers, re Salon should be on your to-try list!

text: When you work or workout too hard, this is the place to go in Charlotte. Whether it's a chronic aching back or a small muscle tear in your shoulder from overuse (ahem, me), I fully recommend visiting Dr. Evan Kahn. I snagged his card at Ultimate Crossfit (the gym where I work out) as I couldn't really move my shoulder too much. Oh, and it hurt like hell. The ladies at the counter greeted my happily on the phone, scheduled my appointment and greeted me again when I walked through the door. The ladies also looked into my insurance to pull more details of how many sessions are covered, co-pay/deductible amounts, etc. That I really appreciate! I also think it's awesome that when one of the ladies answers the phone she says, "Greenapple Sports & Wellness, I can help you!" The office is nice, conveniently located and super clean. Dr. Kahn assessed my injury started treatment that same day and after a few sessions I'm on my way to a normal, functioning shoulder. As other reviewers have stated, whatever kind of injury you have, it's definitely worth a visit to these guys. They're honest, helpful, to the point and trustworthy - exactly what I want out of any doctor!
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Greenapple Sports & Wellness

text: In comparison to the other nearby YMCAs (Dowd, Childress) Gateway is a bit dwarfed. However, as Tm has pointed out, if you're looking for a quick, no fuss workout, this is a perfect place to go. Expect a fair amount of cardio equipment and a decent share of weighlifting machines - all clean and in good working order. You'll also find a small selection of benches and hand weights and a small area to stretch.While I haven't made it to a class here as of yet, it's mainly because the Dowd is closer to my house. Parking can also be a bit difficult, so take heed of the restrictions & meter rules around here! If I'm in the area and need to fit in a fast, efficient workout, the Gateway Y is a great option!

text: I originally chose this office for my contact exam as it's very close to my home. Overall I was really pleased with my visit. Every staff member is very nice and they have a decent selection of frames. Dr. Bailey is very knowledgable and is easy to talk to about your eye needs. Don't be too deceived by the exterior - it's a nice office!

text: Dr. David Wichnoski was my eye doctor in Charlotte for several years before I relocated to Raleigh.   He has two locations, this one near Quail Hollow at the intersection of Rea and Colony Roads, and another location uptown in the BB&T building (Overstreet Mall). Dr. Wichnoski is very personable and thorough, and very good at explaining things in laymen's terms.  His staff is friendly, which is a big deal for me.  I still have and use a pair of dark red-framed Nicole Miller glasses I LOVE, which one of his staff members helped me choose the frames for, which I have no desire to replace.  My contact lenses always arrived in 3-4 days when they ordered them. If you're in Charlotte, I definitely recommend Dr. Wichnoski.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Spectrum Eye Care

text: One-star reviews are extremely rare for me (this is only my second one), and I don't do so lightly.  I went to this dentist for years when I lived in Charlotte, from 1996 to 2009.  They seemed to be okay, though I had a few issues here and there. Once one dentist left me so long that the numbing for a small cavity filling wore off before he got back. Had to re-inject me and wait again while that one took effect. Another dentist (no longer works here) and the dental hygienist talked in a foreign language for a few seconds while they were working on me...and you know what that means as far as what (who) they were talking about...very uncomfortable... I've been blessed with pretty good teeth -- have only had two cavities that I remember, and those were tiny...one didn't even require numbing, and the other was borderline so I opted for it (the aforementioned absentee dentist).  I also had a couple of "clean and seals" where they grind out a soft spot in your enamel and then seal it to prevent it from becoming a cavity. I've since moved to another city and had to get another dentist here locally. On my first visit it was quickly determined that my new dentist would have to re-do everything that this dentist's office had done.  One of my (tiny -- hello?! this shouldn't have been hard!) cavity fillings had since fallen out, unbeknownst to me, and the seals were both poorly done and were leaking.  One of the seals was so bad that decay had formed under it and was starting to get bad -- nothing the new dentist couldn't clean out and fix up, but -- SHEESH!  My new dentist blasted out both seals, cleaned the decay under the one tooth, and redid the seals properly.  He also replaced the now-missing filling on the tiny cavity.Needless to say, I just dropped $300 (my out-of-pocket after insurance) to have this dentist office's work redone.  Not happy.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Charlotte Dentistry

text: My experience with Providence and Dr. Mozayeni was fantastic. The journey that brought me to laser eye surgery has been a long one. I finally had enough with hard contact lenses, glasses, and waking up pretty much blind. Every step of the process was easy and painless..I mean, except for the part where they shoot lasers in your eyes to cut a flap in your cornea, if you're thinking about LASIK, you should already know about this part. The staff was wonderful - efficient and friendly each and every time I went into the office. Dr Mozayeni is one of the most patient and knowledgeable doctors I've come across and I felt like I was in competent hands throughout the process. He's one of the best in the industry and I wanted nothing but the best for my eyeballs. I can see clearly now..the rain has gone. I can see all the obstacles in my wayyy.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True}
name: Providence Eye & Laser Specialists

text: Best clinic I've ever been to. Receptionists are super friendly and quick with paper work and getting you checked in. Nurse is knowledgeable and also very friendly, I feel like an old friend every time I come in. And Dr. Ibe is the most thorough, patient doctor I've ever had. She answers all my questions, makes sure everything that can be done onsite is done (x-rays, vaccinations, other scans, etc.), and is quick about it all without making me feel rushed. She's both a general practitioner and ob-gyn, so that makes things easier.Appointments are easy to make, but may sometimes take more than a day. However, I've walked in before and haven't had to wait a terribly long time. Definitely my #1 recommendation for clinics in the area.
attributes: {'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Cotswold Medical Clinic

text: Dr. Bond came to my rescue in a big way and for that I'll be forever grateful. I had been experiencing mouth pain for about a week which I thought was just an injured gum, but after getting it checked by my dentist I found out it was an impacted wisdom tooth. I had an upcoming medical procedure scheduled that would prevent me from having the tooth extracted for another 2 weeks, so I had to get the surgery within the next few days. My dentist explained the situation to Dr. Bond and he fit me in that very same day. Not only was he incredibly accommodating, but the extraction itself went very smoothly. It seems that pulling teeth is not has painful as they make it seem. His bedside manner was fantastic and his front office was easy to work with. All in all, it was the best dental experience I've ever had. I'd recommend him to anyone in need of solid dental surgeon.
attributes: {'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Southpark Oral Surgery

text: Cotswold Family Medicine has a severe case of Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde.  On one side you have caring, knowledgeable doctors who make an effort to connect with their patients. On the other side you have a management and front office that goes out of its way to make your visit experience as hellish as possible.  I've been going to these doctors since '04 and these shifts in culture only started within the last couple of years.We've had cancellations of appointments (that were made months in advanced) for no reason and at the last moment.  I've had their coordinator schedule back-to-back appointments between specialists and my doctor only to have them attempt to refuse seeing me because of my tardiness (which was expected and had been noted in the appointments by the coordinator herself).  They even fired a phlebotomist who had been with them for over 12 years and was the best damn phlebotomist I had ever encountered.  Not even small, rolling veins could stop this man from painlessly drawing blood from you.The straw that broke the camel's back for me was their "new" policy on prescription refills.  If I had run out of refills and needed a doctor's approval they no longer gave it to the pharmacy if it had been over 30 days since my last visit.  In essence, I would have to schedule a doctor visit every 30 days to continue receiving a medicine that they had already been prescribing me for YEARS.  This blatant attempt at boosting their revenue sickens me.  It doesn't improve your quality of care and penalizes those with limited or non-existent medical insurance.  Would you think it fair to pay out of pocket for a visit (minimum 80 bones and upwards of 150+) when all you need is a refill of your 10 dollar medicine?I will greatly miss the wonderful doctors of this facility, but the hurdles management has put in place are more than I care to go through anymore.
name: Cotswold Family Medicine

text: Snagged a Living Social deal for this place.  Friendly staff and nice doctor.  She was very easy to chat with and answered all my questions thoroughly.  Good teeth cleaning as well.  Only drawbacks were that the place was difficult to find (their signage needs updating) and one of their dental chairs was defective.  The neck rest kept sliding down into my back which made it uncomfortable to sit in.  Also, the constant readjustment of the neck rest killed the flow of my visit.

text: Rehabilitation Services Review - this standard bearer of elderly care is going through some challenges in letting go of past practices.My mother checked in today for a 6 week stay while she recovers from her latest knee surgery.  She will be leaving tomorrow.  While they do offer wi-fi, which may seem like a luxury to some seniors but has been part of my mother's daily life for over 10 years, they do not offer a phone.If you wish to get a phone you have to call the phone company and have it installed as if you were... renting an apartment? She is not in the permanent care portion of the facility.  While other competing providers in the area do not provide wi-fi... this is the only one that does not offer a phone.She is in a semi-private room and there is only one television, and no remote. Her room mate has the curtains drawn and prefers privacy, which is fine, but this means my mother is at the whim of this other person's viewing choices and hours.  She has to have help even getting in a wheel chair right now so not having a remote to mute a TV when a phone call comes in... oh wait... no phones... I guess that's why no remotes?Lastly, there is no choice of food.  My mother hasn't eaten fried food in years... tonight it is either tater tots or no "vegetable" to go with the sloppy joes. With the 4 different antibiotics she is taking all she asks for is simple, salt free, baked or broiled.This was the last straw for her... she contacted another facility in the area and scheduled a transfer.
name: Hudson Elms Nursing Home

text: Had an episode while vacationing in Cleveland - before you ask what was I thinking vacationing in Cleveland - let me finish.Had an episode while vacationing in Cleveland, checked myself into the ER at Hillcrest that led to a 24 hour stay up in the main tower. Therefore, I got the full experience - ER, overnight stay, pre-op, and eventually operations room. Every person in my aid were tremendous, which made my stay as comfortable as possible. Superb nursing staff, nursing aids, and physicians.Hospital food is notorious for being terrible, but I thought the food here wasn't bad here at all. And beds had the inflatable air mattress that adjusts with weight shift.Not that I'll ever look forward to another ER visit, but just wanted to share my wonderful experience with those in need of medical attention in Cleveland.

text: Where I am from, we don't have Marc's. Therefore, I was terrified to go to one through most of college. I had it in my head that it was "discount food." Think about that...who wants to eat old food? or "cheap food?" It brings images of old, moldy produce or green meat. I was pleasantly surprised when I went to my first Marc's in Strongsville. It was clean and organized. The Lakewood Marc's is not that Marc's. Try to avoid weekends or shopping after quitting time. I prefer Aldi's on w.117th for my bargains. However, the only place I know to buy kick-A $1 wigs around Halloween time is Marc's. $1 Halloween wigs is worth a trip to this crazy, scatterbrained discount store. I always feel completely stupid when I am here because I only speak 1.1 languages and everyone else here seems to bilingual.

text: I've been coming to see Dr. Taylor here at Lake Family Practice since I was a wee little Cara. Honestly, I can't say I would ever consider going to someone or somewhere else unless I was forced to. These folks are beyond caring and nice. They're always busy but can always get you in with a day or two, sometimes within hours! And yes, I will drive all the way from Ohio City to go see my favorite doctor all the way in Mentor. It's well worth the 35 minute drive. And yes, I do realize that folks are bringing their families here. But hey, I'm 26 and I'm sitting in the waiting room with all the little kids--I don't care. My parents and my sister still come here, too! You don't have to be a baby to come to a family practice, you know. I also love that I have a medical professional familiar with the health history of not only myself, but my family as well. I know I can come in with questions and get all the answers I need. I also know that Dr Taylor accepts and realizes my ridiculous hypochondria and worry. *Sigh* I almost feel like he deserves a metal for dealing with me. But he's always smiling and nice, so I don't think he minds too much. Anyways, if you're looking for a great family doctor, try looking here at Lake County Family Practice. It's worth the drive, trust me.
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True}
name: Lake County Family Practice

text: Last update for Abram's Eye Center--promise! My eyes have gotten better! Yes, better! text: I was harassed in the parking lot by a uniformed attendant, since i had unknowingly parked in the lot and grabbed a snack from robeks nearby before heading back to marcs. I understand it was a policy, but I'm from out of town and was only there to buy a six pack for a family party. It was Saturday morning at 11am, the lot was less than half full. The rest is good I guess, but I was left smoldering from being berated by a mall security cop in the parking lot.

text: Marc's has some of the cheapest groceries you're going to find in Parma.  That's why I shop here.  I figure, 'you could pay more, but why?'Pros: low prices, interesting selection of random, non-grocery items like furniture, paintings, ice scrapers, ink pens, you name it.Cons: Limited payment options.  Accepts cash, check, Marc's gift card, Discover Card.  Sometimes the gift cards don't work, which blows my mind.  Inconsistent in-stock condition.  One week, they'll have a product, the next week, they won't have it.  Marc's doesn't have a 'great' selection, but they usually have what you need.  Slow checkout.It is obvious that Marc's management does everything humanly possibly to cut costs, which is great.  They take it a step too far though, in my opinion.  I understand cutting costs to reduce operating expenses and then passing those savings to customers.  But can't they at least update the registers?  I mean, I have to buy gift cards from my daughter's school (screwy part of her tuition agreement) because her school gets kickbacks for selling so many dollars worth of gift cards each month.  When I go to use my Marc's giftcards, the cashiers usually can't figure out how to scan them in the system.  I guess the scanners suck or the gift card bar codes are too thin.  Anyway, this function needs improvement.Overall, Marc's is good, but nowhere near as good, or expensive, as Giant Eagle.
