name: Ulta Beauty

text: Again, what great experiences when coming here for both my man's haircut and a trim for the little guy. John is the man to go to here, period. I've been around salons since I was little. I like to think that I know a little bit about stlists, and this guy just rocks. I'm sure if he ever left that we'd follow him to whatever local salon he chose to work. He truly puts a lot of time and attention into his cuts and styles. I've only witnessed his expertise with mens and boys cuts, but watching his work makes me think he's great with the ladies styles, too. The little guy has really, really thick, straight hair. It can get really heavy on him, floppy and almost a little anime-ish. He's never liked getting his hair cut and went through a phase where he just wanted it long and in his eyes. But recently I feel like John slowly worked with him out of that icky style and really helped him figure out what look was really him. This past time we left the salon and the little guy said it was the best haircut ever and he really liked his hair. I've never, ever heard him say this--and he was right, it really was the cutest cut I've seen on him. John even convinced him that just a little bit of product in his hair was OK and now he's interested in styling  it. So cute!My guy has thinner hair and doesn't like his hairline. We both told John exactly what he didn't like about his grown out style and he just got to work. Long story short, the haircut was exactly what my man had in mind and he looked delicious. I'm a HUGE fan of the new 'do. He's happy and confident, I'm happy and we love John! To summarize, if you're going to Crazy Mullets, ask for John!

text: Anyone who even *kind of* knows me knows that I don't joke around about hair. Well, this is where my incredibly phenomenal hair stylist worked before she moved on to where she is now. I can't help but still love L&G, if not for the hair, then the spa. (I'll never cheat on my hair stylist!!)Yes, even this thrifty lady can splurge every once in a blue moon on a lovely spa day... and I'm way overdue for another one!L&G is a very eco-friendly spa with a focus on natural products. They use Aveda, which I love. In fact, I think they put an addictive ingredient in the scent, because one you use it you're hooked! Natural oils, hour long massages, facials without abrasive chemicals, this place is right up my alley. My skin is very sensitive, so what a spa uses is of great importance to me!Want a mani/pedi? You'll get the most natural, gentle experience at L&G. Some nail places really creep me out with all their metal tools and stuff. I mean, they're reusing those on everyone! Not here. They have disposable tools that gently treat your rough skin without ripping it all off. They'll even send you home with the pumice stone for future usage. Love that! No tipping, pretty good prices, natural products and gentle procedure. Ladies and Gentlemen Salon and Spa is my kind of place!Just FYI - gift certificates here for a spa day or just a hair do make amazing gifts. Trust me! I've given them and got them!

name: Ladies & Gentlemen Salon and Spa

text: After 10 years (at least) of entrusting one of my very best friends with my hair styling--I was a little nervous to get my locks done after she moved to NYC. And that's even after knowing how talented every stylist is at Eddy's. I'm very, very picky about my hair and about color. No visible "streaks" or "highlights" for this gal. It has to look natural--like it wasn't purposefully "done." Well, thank goodness for Eddy's and thank goodness for Mandy. She's taken over many of my friend's clients since she moved to NYC and we're all in extremely qualified hands! Don't get me wrong--I very much miss Breanna, but Mandy kicks ass at color and totally went above and beyond to make me happy/comfortable/not anxious. She is now my go-to gal for all things hair and she should be your's, too! Well, that is if you appreciate great hair and talent! I'm OBSESSED with pumped up color, cut--everything. My hair looks much healthier, happier and it's so wonderful to know that I'm in great hands with Mandy. We chatted the whole time non-stop and it feels like all the hair planets have aligned again! I cannot recommend her enough. One suggestion? Make your appointment a couple of weeks in advance! I know guys are used to just springing on a hair appointment last minute, but most gals will tell you to get an appointment with someone really talented--some advance notice is required. This isn't Best Cuts, mmmkay? IF you're a guy, it might still be easy for you to get a last minute booking, but ladies--if you're looking for color, please give your stylists the same respect you'd want--give them some notice and call in advance! I make my next appointment when I pay at the counter. You can always reschedule it. Just do it.

name: Eddy's On Coventry

text: This is a tough review to write because the girls who helped us were dolls, but this place needs to step it up a notch on just a couple of fronts....1) Although the girl who did my sister's pedi and gel mani was the sweetest ever (and did a great pedicure)--when a client calls and makes an appointment for a gel mani SPECIFICALLY, you don't give them someone who has never done one before. Period. My sister, although ultimately happy with the result, had her nails redone about 4 times. The girl who was helping her did everything she could to make sure that when my sister left, her gel mani was right, but still... poor form. 2) When I came in I told them the design I wanted on my nails, they told me they could do it. They couldn't. In fact, they have one girl there who can do nail art the way it's supposed to be done. That's it. And she wasn't there. My gal ( I will not share her name because I don't want her connected to a so-so review. She's great!) just couldn't get the help and support she needed. She could do some nail art, but there was NO ONE there to help her with what she couldn't do. She tried two different methods to get my nails done and just couldn't get it. I felt awful for her--but I also was getting really upset. By the time we left we had been there about 3.5 hours. That's WAY tooo long. I had things to do and I had not planned on more than 1.5hrs, which is more than enough for your standard pedi and gel mani. 3) I also watched them turning away multiple walk-in clients when their signage outside clearly stated "walk-ins welcome." That could seem like a positive to some, but to me I saw two customers leaving with a horrible taste in their mouths... it was visible on their faces. If I were the business owner, I WOULD NEVER want any employee of mine to treat a potential customer that way. There are so many ways to remedy that situation. But if I were a business owner, I'd offer any walk-in client who couldn't be served anytime that day a discount on their next service. But that's just me. Now on to the positives, which there are plenty. The space itself is large and very clean. Each pedicure station looked freshly cleaned--all with signage assuring you so. Their gel nail color selection is one of the best and most updated I've seen around. You'll have a hard time choosing most certainly. They have a simple and moderately priced pedicure, but be careful what you say "yes" to as it will add extra charges. They have varying scented lotions you can pick from for your pedicures and the pedi's themselves look great. My gel manicure, although not entirely what I wanted, was a well-done manicure-- and my sister's was too, after 4 tries.

text: My first professional gel mani/pedi in probably about 5 years--I know... it was time.Normally you're asking to be disappointed when you're rushing around before a trip and you drop-in to grab a quick mani/pedi. But not at Liz Nails! This place was not only recommended by the Yelp community, but also from my gal friends on facey-space. So I gave them a try on a Monday afternoon... when I was in a mad rush... right before I left for a trip. Yep, I did that to myself. But the Liz Nails folks handled it perfectly. I stepped in the same time as another lady looking for the same gel mani/pedi service. I mentioned I was in a big hurry and without a minute passing the had invited both this lady and I to the back to get our pedicures started. Without skimping on service, the gentleman helping me got me through a great pedicure without delay. In fact, the longest part of the whole process was picking out the damn nail color. Then my first gel manicure was a great experience! It went quickly and has lasted well over a week at this point. He did it perfectly and I can't wait to come back to get my next manicure. One thing I think that could be improved on is the color selection. It's not that they don't have a lot of colors, but normally when I've gone to nail salons they have displays out with new, relevant and seasonal color lines. This is helpful to those of  us who don't get our nails done often and are really indecisive. I think I'll just come in better prepared next time. The price was around what I remember when I used to get my nails done more often. I think next time I"ll just get my toe nails painted (not a full pedi) when I get my gel manicure. And hopefully the service always stays this good!

name: Liz Nails

text: *Sad Face* my childhood mall is going down the pooper. I feel like this mall has been on the steady decline since I was a little Cara. Granted, it does have a few savior stores, but for the most part they've all come and gone. There used to be a Gap... an Aldo... all bye-bye!Don't get me wrong, Great Lakes Mall does have some redeeming qualities. For one, the quality stores they do have tend to have more of my sizes left since they're not as busy as other malls. Score! The staff at most shops seem to be nicer and willing to actually assist you. For instance, every time I go to The Limited I don't want to leave! The girls there are so wonderful and give you honest opinions. It's like having a private shopper! This mall is also doing a better job of filling in empty spaces, which is way better than hearing the echo of your own voice down the hall. One last positive that I'll mention: this mall is easy to shop. Why? Well, it's usually empty. I admit, I live to shop. But I never like a crowded store or mall... in fact, it's infuriating! Especially when I just stop in to grab something quick and it takes forever because some idiot is holding up a line over a huge return that she clearly just shoplifted. (God. I love run-on sentences.)With Great Lakes Mall, I'm usually in and out--no annoying hassles or crowds.

text: This is my last update, I promise. I just have a cool story to share. It's a great example of and shout out to their customer service and talent. In the past few weeks, Riya's has become harder and harder to get appointments within the week you call. I came back from a 10-day vacation with two missing nails from my acrylic set. For my ladies who know, missing nails make you feel like a hot mess, no matter how fancy you dress yourself up. So, I called Riya's and they couldn't get me in for TWO WEEKS! In an act of desperation, I used the Yelp app to find another place to get my nails done. The reviews were mostly about pedicures and gel manis, which should have been my first flag. Acrylic nails aren't easy. But I took a chance, brought an exact photo (from Riya's) of what I wanted and hoped for the best.Welp, that was a mistake. I walked away with animal claws. My boyfriend's reaction word was, "gross" and I'm out $45 for a crappy result. In another act of desperation, I walked in to Riya's the next day to see if they could squeeze me in to fix what the other salon had done. Kim (she's amazing) took time out of her lunch break to squeeze me in and make my nails beautiful again. It cost me only $15. These girls are talented, thoughtful and WORTH THE WAIT. I have not found another place in CLE that has better artists than Riya's.

text: I've worked with HennaMe numerous times in the past for events, but until a recent party I hadn't been lucky enough to actually get some done on myself. And now... I'm addicted! I may not know a ton about henna, but I do know art and Kristina is an amazing artist. Her designs seem to integrate authentic design with a modern twist--which I love. She makes her own paste from scratch using only authentic, natural ingredients, including lemon juice, sugar and essential oils. I sat down and within mere minutes she'd created something gorgeous and phenomenal on my hand (see the pics) Coming from a very pale gal who tends to be OCD about her skin (no tattoos for me) I was worried this was going to be a shock for me--it lasts 1-3 weeks! But I've been obsessed--in a good way--since I got it. And now I want her to do my entire back! Furthermore, she gives you a card with all the info you need to know about caring for your new henna piece, including day-of care and long-lasting maintenance tips. She travels to you if need her to and her charge is by the hour. I can't say more about Kristina and her henna. If you're looking to get some done or even want to have her at an event, you will NOT be disappointed.
attributes: {'BusinessAcceptsBitcoin': False}
name: Cleveland Henna

text: Haven't been here in years, but used to go to Serena, one of the owners.  She was recommended to me by Mary Swank (owner of Simply Swank in Hudson, OH) when I was trying to find a place closer to my job in Avon, OH.Serena was extremely friendly & did a great job on cut & color the few times I went.

text: With the colder weather picking up in the Pittsburgh area - it's easy to get dry wind-chapped skin and to just want to stay indoors.La Pomponee not only will nourish your skin with lovely all natural products and a soft touch - but they'll have you looking so radiant that you'll be aching to take your glowing cheeks out.I came here with my mom when we were visiting my brother and all of their staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.They provided lush robes, a private locker for our stuff, and even gave us new flip-flops. My facialist was so lovely and warm and she massaged love and kindness into my skin using Aveda's magical all natural products. She even did some hand and feet massaging as well. So blissful!My facial had no extractions or un-natural chemicals applied to it. It was all about nourishing the skin. It's reassuring to know that you're going to walk into a facial and come out with soft supple skin - rather than a face full of red marks and peeling. I would definitely come to La Pomponee again - for a relaxing day full of epic massage and good vibes.If you're looking for more vigorous facial and want more pronounced results - you may want to look elsewhere. For simple natural glowing skin though - La Pomponee is the way to go.Trust.

text: I had a really hard time finding a nail salon in Pittsburgh.  I really liked this one though because the owners were so personable and cool.  They have been at this location for over 15 years.It is a no frills type of place, but you can tell that the couple really care about their customers.  I had a really nice conversation with both of them and they did a really great job on my nails.  It's been almost 10 days and my nails still look pretty awesome.

text: I mean...seriously? I should have known better given that it only had one positive review. My 600th yelp review, you think I'd've learned by now!I wandered in here looking for a pedicure. My first hint should have been the old crusty polishes on the walls - no Essie etc here. But whatever, I picked out my color and headed to the dilapidated pedicure chair. (I put my bag on the adjacent tray and it couldn't support the weight). They don't use razors here, which is fine, but I expected a thorough scrubbing of my callouses, and when she gave me a tiny little once over then unceremoniously threw my feet back into the water I thought to myself, OK there's no way on earth this is more than a $10 pedicure right? My heels still looked as bad as they did when I walked in. Then she painted my nails and sat me down at the "dryer" which consisted of two tiny fans pointed at my feet. For real. I had to sit there for over ten minutes, she proclaimed my toes dry, then I paid - $25?!!!! For $25 in Boston where I'm from I could get a legit pedicure. I was dumbfounded. I paid, walked home, and lo and behold two of my toes already had smudged polish. ARGH!

name: Kenny's Nail Center

text: It's a cute store, but I didn't see anything original or interesting that I haven't seen at Lush.  The ducky soaps are cute.  It has a "homemade" feel to the products, which doesn't quite match the price point.  Still, it smells good and the staff are nice.

She wasn't even mad we were late (although I don't recommend being late).  Great place for kids, and she'll even do a "princess" style at the end; the little one I accompanied got the "Belle" from "Beauty and the Beast," it was very cute.

text: Okay, so I never thought I'd be into the whole "hot stone massage" thing. I like basic massages for my sore, stressed neck and love a good foot, hand, face, and everything-in-between massage. However, here I was in Pittsburgh, visiting the folks, and needing a bit of stress-relief. In comes google and Yelp to the rescue! I received an absolutely amazing hot stone massage for a very reasonable price ($70/hour) at Judit European Visage. I learned that the hot stones help my muscles relax, and that being pressed with them (they're smooth) is very relaxing and calming. I also run cold (circulation issues), so the warmth from the stone felt amazing! Calming music, a quiet room, (a chance to be massaged with my partner also getting a massage in the same room), and a strong and gentle massage therapist, and I left feeling like a new person in our newly cleaned car (see review for CleanTown below). The owner also offered bottles of spring water and homemade walnut bread. It was really sweet of her.It's been a great week, and Judit European Visage is part of that greatness! ;) I highly recommend them for a beautiful experience.

text: Since my previous review, a lot has changed at Above All Grand Salon and Spa. Haircuts are less expensive (I got mine done by one of the owners, so perhaps that's why it was more expensive), and they've widened their types of massages. The current owner wrote me and was very responsive to my previous reviews, and I have to say that attentiveness like this reflects the quality of the business.

text: I went to Brandy back when she was at Mint on Ellsworth. She was my favorite stylist to date in Pittsburgh, and unfortunately she left and started cutting hair on the Southside - a bit too far for me to make the trek regularly.After a long, long time of wandering between salons, trying to find a stylist and salon that could meet expectations - I never did. I finally searched Yelp for "brandy hair" and Hairsmith popped up. Apparently, she's been here, operating her own place for a year! I wish I'd known!The place is awesome, historic, and feels like a good cross between a barber shop and a salon. It is totally Brandy.Online booking is so convenient and awesome. I don't know why not everywhere offers this service. I do wish that it sent a calendar event so it would appear in my Google Calendar. Perhaps in the future.Regarding the haircut - I explained what I was kind of going for, and she listened, paid close attention to the shape of my head, the directions my hair grows, assessed potential issues with the cut ahead of time, was vocal about her plan and precisely what she was going to do, and what she was doing while she was cutting. She's detailed, but efficient about it. Her training was  clearly excellent (I've had consistently good cuts from stylists who studied at Toni & Guy) and she seems to take pride in her work. She seems to particularly excel in short cuts, men's cuts, and asymmetric or European-inspired cuts. I haven't been this happy with a haircut is a long, long, time. It is good to be back :-)

name: Hairsmith

text: There is a lot to lake about Whitehouse Salon. It is a clean, friendly and chic atmosphere. There's a bit of confusion as to what door is the entrance, and they seem utterly confused and not set up for people taking the stairs up instead of the elevator. Some signage in the stairwells would help.I went to two stylists here - Sharon and LaVerne. Both seemed quite competent, but my frustrations primarily come with timeliness of this place. I think I came here 3 or 4 times. None of the times did my appointment start within 15 minutes of when it was supposed to. With Sharon, I was always double-booked while she was doing a coloring of another client's hair, so I usually ended up with an assistant washing my hair, waiting, and then getting my hair cut while the other client was waiting for color to set, and they continued their conversation. It is kind of awkward, and feels like you're not getting 100% attention from the stylist.Sharon is extremely meticulous in her work, making sure there is not a stray hair out of place, following the grain of my hair, and taking great care to make everything even. If I were getting married or going to appear on TV, I'd probably want this level of care. But, when it's a random Tuesday and I'm trying to meet up for dinner with friends, or make it back to work without spending 2 hours at the salon - it is a bit overkill.One time when I was in dire need of a cut, and Sharon wasn't available, I went to LaVerne. LaVerne did a good job, but my cut didn't quite turn out how I wanted - and was quite a bit shorter than I was going for. I'd try going to her again, though.I'm not completely against this place because there's a lot to like, but I'm not totally in love with it, either, as I've had better. It is above average for Pittsburgh, and if I'd definitely recommend it over some other places for somebody looking for a cut. I'd like to check out their nail services, too.

text: Unfortunately, I can no longer recommend Mint salon.I liked it very much when they were on Ellsworth. I first went to Haley, and she was great. But then she left. So I started going to Brandy, and she was great. Then she left. Hmm, a trend?So I  then tried Danielle, and wasn't so impressed with her cut. At this point, the trend of good stylists leaving was enough of a concern that I started looking elsewhere to get my haircut.MCN, Avenue E, Whitehouse Salon, Alder Barber, and some others later - I've never come to find anybody I've liked as much as Haley or Brandy. So, I thought I'd come back to Mint's new location and get a cut from Kelley. It just wasn't a great experience. The door was open on a warm humid rainy day, so it was damp and uncomfortable inside. Kelley was friendly, but didn't come across as very professional. In the end, she cut off a lot more hair than I'd wanted, and left the sides pretty bushy and uneven, and kind of shrugged her shoulders, said my hair was hard to deal with, and that was that.Sad, but I won't be back.

text: I finally decided to go to Zhang's after some recommendations from some co-workers, as well as reading reviews here.Honestly, this is probably one of the best massages that I've ever gotten. Relaxing? Maybe.. for... parts of it. Effective? Deep tissue? Absolutely.Mary figured out exactly what was wrong with my back without me even telling her that my shoulders/back hurt. She could just tell from feeling it. The combination of ashiatsu, deep tissue, Swedish, Thai, hot stone, and Chinese massages was wonderful. I left feeling aligned, loosened, and overall just great. She put a ton of work and muscle into kneading the knots out of my back, legs, etc. Prices are very reasonable. 60 minutes was $60 at the time of this writing. And, it was *actually* 60 full minutes, not like a 50-minute hour. Most places are far more expensive or require some shady contract.There were a few downsides, but none enough to lose a star for me:1) Its cash-only. They didn't warn me, so I had to go get some cash from an ATM afterwards.2) The table was a bit short for me. But, I'm a pretty tall guy. The face cutout was also a little tiny for my head - squishing my nose a bit. I'd prefer a different table.3) As others mentioned, there is a bit of a different attitude towards modesty. I opted to completely disrobe, as I've found most therapists can do a much better job on the glutes (and after doing squats, lunges, deadlifts, rowing, skiing, biking, running, etc I need them to do a good job) with no clothing in the way. Ultimately, I was glad I made that decision, as she was indeed able to massage the hell out of my butt muscles and lower back without obstruction. I was covered in a towel which was displaced as necessary, but it most certainly wasn't always covering all the manbits at all times. Oh well. At the end of the day, I completely didn't care, though, because she was absolutely professional about it and I was in such a state of zen muscular submission that the towel wasn't even necessary. I could see this may bother others, though, so keep that in mind.4) I called ahead to make an appointment, but I don't think they actually took my name. So, I'm not quite sure how that's supposed to work.I'll be back, for certain.

name: Zhang's Relaxation Centre

text: Though my haircut wasn't terrible, I won't be back here. It just doesn't live up to standards that I am used to in a nice salon. I've certainly been to worse.My appointment started about 30 minutes late, which stinks. I was about ready to walk out of the place, and then finally was available.There's one couch to sit on and wait. Not a huge deal, but I imagine it could get uncomfortable if there were more people waiting.The atmosphere looks amazing in photos, but feels not-so-great in person. The overhead lights are fluorescent and cold/sterile. There was some guy going around painting or something. The owner was shouting across the room at the other stylists and the painter guy - and had a bit of a rougher personality. It wasn't calming.My stylist, Anthony, was a pretty nice guy. Not quite what I was expecting, for some reason. We made some small-talk, and he seemed to take his time and was detailed for the most part. However, I didn't quite end up with the cut that I wanted despite what I thought were clear directions - the back of my hair ended up pretty clean/ cropped, rather than fringes. It wasn't botched or bad - just not what I wanted. Granted, I didn't even know that until I got home because he never showed me in the mirror. Then, when it came time to pay, they charged $40 instead of $33 like I had been told on the phone. I could have haggled or said something, but my mind was already made up that this was a 2-star place and I wouldn't be coming back, so I just payed it. But, watch out for bait-and-switch if you do go.
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': True, 'WheelchairAccessible': False}
name: Nadia Salon

text: Two stars seems harsh, but honestly I'm not sure I'd rate my experience here A-OK.Firstly - I quite liked the space. It was well designed, kind of quirky and cool, and very open (literally, the garage door was open).The haircut I got was good - it just wasn't quite what I asked for. I asked for a mohawk - including the tail in the back. I didn't realize until the end of the haircut that the back was entirely shaved, and I only had length left on the top. At least it was cut evenly and only cost $20. Now I just have to wait to grow it out to get the look I wanted to begin with.The experience during the cut wasn't my favorite. While I prefer the person cutting my hair to be focused on my hair, not conversation, I also don't want to be entirely bored. The barber started blasting music as soon as I sat down, and then tried to converse with me over the music, constantly asking me to repeat myself because he couldn't hear me. Wtf? Do you want me to shut up and listen to your jams, or to have a conversation? I can't do both!I wanted to give them a try given all of the hype on here, but at the end of the day, I think I'm more comfortable in the right quiet salon where the stylist washes my hair, blow dries away all the little hair clippings so I'm not covered in them all day, and seems to give a shit about what I asked for.

text: This is hard to update after such a great review I'd written before, but unfortunately, as much as I liked the cuts from Tim K, I couldn't stand the conversation anymore and I had to stop going. What I was hoping was just the awkward first-time-client phase that I mentioned in the first review never really ended. Some comments were fairly insensitive - particularly a bit sexist, and some comments were directed at people being too sensitive about his comments.When I found myself anxious to just get the hell out of the chair so it could end, I decided it was no longer the place for me :-/

text: I was staying at the Pennsylvanian in Pittsburgh for a business trip, so it pleased me that there was a place for me to get a haircut in the same building.  Jeanie did a great job on my hair.  She offered me a robe, so that my hair would not devour my clothes.  My stylist took time to cut my hair the way I wanted it and I could not be happier with the end result.  The view from my chair outlooking the window was a sight to behold.  The cleanliness of a salon is high on my list of priorities and Sognatore passed that test.The price for a men's haircut is $26, so it is rather steep for some.  Sognatore is closed Sunday & Monday.  I would also recommend making a reservation.

text: As someone who travels weekly for business, including working long hours and bringing all luggage via carry-on, it takes a toll on my body, and I also tend to hold all this stress in my shoulders and back. While I was initially staying at the Marriott Springhill Suites at Bakery Square, I saw this establishment and called to inquire and make an appointment back on October 16th. I scheduled a 90 minute deep tissue massage with Jessica. Including tip, I paid $89.98. Great price for a first time visitor special!However, though I was happy with both the facility and the price, I found Jessica to be rather cold and short - no matter what I did to make small talk, build rapport, and/or explain my pain points in order to best mitigate. I almost felt as though I was the customer service professional providing the service, rather than the reverse - this was how far I had to go to establish a bond, and even then I felt more judged by Jessica than the reverse. Her attitude and demeanor were not something I'd want to experience again, and this is unfortunate given her chosen profession - helping people relax and feel comfortable.Also, the massage was decent - good when she got to my back, but the front leg and arm and neck massage was slightly awkward and uncomfortable, I recall. Also, though she asked about aromatherapy, I found it weird that she called it something like "smelly stuff" - unprofessional. Also, I wish I'd been offered hot stones, as I would have (and had planned to) happily add that to my service. All in all, I wasn't too impressed or pleased, but it wasn't terrible.

text: Its not closed but it is lacking a bit in professionalism. I got a "style out" a couple weeks ago and was amused the brush he chose to use was missing most of its bristles. The stylist did have my hair looking better than when I walked in but I daresay the owner is a cheapskate. In addition to the sad brush, the owner is reluctant to use the credit card machine or accept checks so I paid cash. Fortunately I had the cash on me because normally I don't roll with greenbacks and debit everything.

text: My sister insisted we go here for wedding hair.  I told her the horrible experience I had last time. She told her stylist about the horrible stuff that happened last time and said not to worry, that none of those people work there anymore (it was in Dec 2001 that they made my hair a frizzy mess for my brother's wedding).I am fairly certain, that due to my bad experience last time, they made sure I got the best hair guy. This is only the second time I've had a guy do my hair but he seemed to be one of the head honchos around. Short, nice fellow with a mustache whose name escapes me. Ed? possibly. He took the time to discuss what I wanted and took his time creating.I walked out with great curls. Not too poofy, not too tight, long pretty model on a runway curls. He also took the time to re position my rhinestone starfish (hey it was an aquarium wedding reception) three times to make sure it was perfect and pinned that sucker so it wouldn't move. So why four stars? Well one bridesmaid had to sit for 20 minutes and had to raise a ruckus before they started working on her hair and we were on a time crunch. I guess they were short a stylist but still, not nice to give my sister and mom a minor heart attack because they are whipcrackers when there's a time schedule. In the end, it all ended up ok. Parking is still difficult over there but the salon has improved. I believe our bridesmaid hair styles cost $40 a piece.

text: Not the best place to get nails, even though it's conveniently in the mall.  Yes they do the basics,  but they're not careful. For $17, I want a great manicure that can do better than myself.  Instead I got under average nails.

text: I still haven't found a decent nail salon in the Pittsburgh area.  This place is like the others.  They carry OPI and China Glaze polish, and they do manicures, pedicures, acrylic, gel, and waxing. SERCVICE: I had the regular mani and pedi.  The guy cut my cuticles too much, botched on the polish, and wasn't very helpful with suggestions on polish color.  Plus they overcharged me. If I'm paying to get my nails done, then I want them near perfect.  And this place did not add up.

text: I was a little unsure about a nail salon with all Vietnamese men workers.  Usually it's women.  I was referred through a friend, so I gave it a try.  I came here for a mani and pedi which is $45.  I thought the price was a little steep.  I was offered a variety of pedicures, but I chose a regular pedi.  First of all, he didn't clean up all the skin/cuticle area like I wanted.  Next he didn't apply the polish neatly, therefore it was streaky.  Finally, the instruments he used were not sanitized and used customer after customer.  I wouldn't come here again.

text: If you're not using the Great Clips app on your phone to check in before you drive over to the salon, you're taking a chance that you'll have a long wait. I was driving past and decided to pop in. Oh, there's only one person waiting, so I parked my car and headed inside. While I was waiting, one of the online check-in people arrived. They're ahead of me. And then another online check-in person arrived. They're also ahead of me.Nope, I headed out.They were very nice about it, but the online check in is your place in line. Even if there are people who walk in ahead of you. It's a good system if you use it.

text: Another formulaic execution of the Walgreens system. text: Finally, there is a place in Fort Mill that specializes in massages.  There are other places to get a massage, but they are almost all in salons or chiropractic offices.I purchased a 60 minute massage through Groupon, which is always good when trying a place for the first time.  The business is in a small office park near the intersection of Gold Hill Rd and Hwy 160 (about 2 miles from the current Charlotte Knights stadium or 2 miles from the Rivergate shopping center in Steele Creek).  The small waiting area is dimly lit and very relaxing, which was nice.  They have many therapists here, and mine for this session was Sonja.  She was very good and worked out quite a few kinks.  The whole setting was very good and relaxing.  I could hear little else outside the room during the massage and almost fell asleep a couple of times.  I felt very refreshed and relaxed after the massage.  The only reason the review is only four stars is that although this massage was very good, I have had better.  On a scale of 1-10, I would give the massage and 8.  Would I go back here?  Definitely.

text: Right over the state line on Hwy 521 is this relatively new Supercuts.  They sent us some coupons in the mail so I decided to give them a shot.  I almost always get my hair buzzed short with the same length all the way around.  Although their normal adult haircut is $14.95, they charge only $10 for this cut, so I have returned a few times.  Although it's possible to mess up a buzz cut, they have yet to do it here, so I will keep returning.  They also do color, highlights, etc, for reasonable prices.  One negative is that a child's haircut is $13.95 - only a dollar cheaper than the adult haircut as the dad in front of me found out.  I've never seen a franchised salon charge that much for a kids cut.
address: 10092 Charlotte Hwy Ste 102, Six Mile Commons

text: Alright I'm a guy, and comfortable enough with my manhood to get a manicure so there.  I had a meeting down the road and had about 30 minutes to spare so in we go for a quick manicure.I've only done this one other time in my life so let's face it, I'm not going to be a regular but on the surface it was a great experience.  My nails are generally bitten so this lady had her work cut out for her....but she handled it like a pro.  Nice clipping, filing, soaking and hand massaging.  All in all, nice!  The lady was pleasant and worked efficiently to get me out of there in the alotted time.  I will say this, my nails have never been so shiny.I think it was like $15.00 and for a bit of "me" time it was worth it.

text: Asian family run.  Wife likes friendly atmosphere and good detailed work.  And can get there in golf cart from Sun City.Hard working with everyone making the family successful.  Even dad is at the nails.  It is so impressive to walk in as you are warmly greeted and treated as a special guest as a guy waiting for his wife.  Lots of shy smiles...charming.My wife says that she likes that they insist that your nails are dry before you leave.  But as sometimes ladies do leave with wet polish, Classy Nails very kindly will touch you up...with out lecture.A classy place, with a classy attitude.

text: I loved my massuse. Her name is Kandance/Candance ... I forgot ask but she's thorough, attentive, prompt with her start time and also executed my back facial.  I found this place via Groupon. And I am glad because it was a good find I purchased a massage back facial and a facial. Candice took care of the massage and back facial with very good detail to her work and when the pressure was a bit much for me as only twice but she had just it accurately actually superbly. Now she start as soon as I walked in and I must admit I was a bit caught off guard no one had me complete any paperwork but I'm more appreciative that we started immediately and I arrived ten minutes before my appointment to complete paperwork.I was told for the facial that I was just a basic facial with the Groupon so it would not include a mask and extractions I upgraded or another $40 which is a bit pricey and I don't have to have it again. The owner completed my facial and she was nice enough.  The place and Decor is very aesthetically pleasing.  Water is offered in a wine glass and the robes are provided as you go between the rooms; however, the owner could stand to replace the sheets. As the sheets on the table for the facial room or estheticians room wasn't dirty but you could tell they had been stained.Anywho, I had every intention on giving five stars after getting my massage but that facial left a lot to be desired she was throwing her extractions but literally I think the group hunt yeah the group was $100 then another 40 to upgrade the face show I feel like it was a Hustle and with that being said I've had better facials I mean kneaded relief is great. Nonetheless; I will give kudos for the extractions on my face so that was done very well. I had to hold my mask longer than the five minutes I was initially told (she left me for 15m) this would not have been a big deal had I not needed to make a trip to Rock Hill and return to work.All in all the prices have increased because there's a manual change on the menu but I will return for services from Candace as again...I  applaud her effort, her pressure, her professionalism and her bedside manner. Also, she does a great job stretching the neck and I usually have to find people to do that. She did it without me saying a word about it. Love it!!They are right off exit 90 past the QT in the shopping strip. So you can get some cheap gas and go get a massage and facial and there's a nail shop next door and a gym so it's a win-win all around.

text: Oh my goodness!Kevin and I had not been to a couple massage in a couple of years and we were overdue.  All of our places that we had been too previously were on the other side of town so it was a matter of finding something closer to home.  After reviewing multiple reviews on Yelp and looking at pricing of different places, we finally decided on Sanctuary Massage.We knew we wanted a Saturday or Sunday (yes they have Sunday appointments!!) appointment with two females so I called in to book.   It took a little while to find something available, I believe we had a month and half to two month wait before we could get something scheduled.  It was worth the wait!Kevin had Irma giving him his massage and I had Pam giving me my massage.  Kevin thought that was the best massage he has had yet!!  I would rank mine right up there as well.  I really enjoyed it because it was a true full body message and they gave us a full 60 minute message, not cheating us out of 5 minutes to relax and get changed!  We both thought our therapists gave the right intensity at the right time.I think my only complaint...very small one...is that the rooms are not on the interior of the building like at other places I have been to.  While they have room darkening curtains, that doesn't stop you from hearing outside noises.  They are in a relatively quiet business park (especially for a Sunday), but I did hear a car horn at one point.The messages were so great that we booked to go back later in the year.  Looking forward to making this a quarterly event as Sanctuary has some of the best pricing with the best massages!

name: Sanctuary Massage and Facial Spa

text: I went back for a haircut yesterday, unfortunately Jewell was not there, but I decided to go for this Great Clips again.  Had I had another hair stylist, this could have possibly been another 4 star review.  My review with Jewell still stands, but my experience yesterday needs to be mentioned.  Most of my 1 star reviews are because of bad customer service, and this is no different.I walked in and was told it was a 30-40 minute wait.  I decided to wait it out, it actually did not take that long to wait, but here is my issue...  There were only two stylist working and they were super busy after the work day was over for most people.  I had just watched them finish with 3-4 people and there were still three people waiting at the store and three people had just signed in online, so you knew it was going to be continuously busy.  At that time, one of the hair stylist went out back.  One of the guys that checked in online came in and asked if there was just one stylist there.  The other stylist said "there is another one here but she went out back, not sure why she went out back, but she did."  Not only did this one stylist make it look bad for Great Clips to go take a smoke break when you have essentially 6 people waiting, but she also made it bad for her coworker to have to give an excuse to incoming customers about her break.  Just great, I was the next in line for this person because the other two in front of me wanted to wait for the other stylist.  I could have done the same, but I decided to go ahead with her.  Of course after having a smoke break, she reeked of smoke.  Not everyone appreciates that smell or wants your smoke hands to be working with their hair.There is a time and place for smoke breaks, but not when you have six people waiting and have a haircut to do immediately after.Aside from all of that, my haircut was pretty good, but she did not really like it when I wanted to cut my hair a little bit more than originally requested.  So not the greatest attitude either, but at least my hair does not look bad.West Town Market - Please work with L****n and her customer service if you are going to employ her.
address: West Town Market, 1750 Hwy 160 W, Ste 103
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Great Clips

text: Blue Sky just opened, and I was excited to have a new go-to nail salon so close to my house since my usual place is in south Charlotte. I stopped in around noon on a Friday for a polish change since I thought that would be an easy, less intense way to check it out than a manicure or pedicure.Blue Sky is on the far end of a strip mall-ish facility, so the inside definitely felt very sterile to me (and not sterile like you want a nail salon to feel); the walls were white, the floor was tile, there was nothing on the walls, and there was no TV. It looked like they were planning to install one, so maybe they're still getting their decor down. However, it did seem very clean, and I saw a couple of rooms that were used for waxing. But I digress!When I walked in, I told the two women behind the front desk that I needed a polish change. They asked hands or toes; I said hands, and that was the last time anyone spoke to me in English. They appeared to have a gel bar, which was pretty cool, but I'm a basic polish girl, so I I started looking for a color. Their selection was a seriously limited for natural/nude colors. They had OPI and another brand I didn't recognize, and the first color I picked looked like White Out on my nails. The technician nicely let me change and came up to the wall to help me pick. I wound up going with Bubble Bath - the only nude-ish color they had - which still isn't my favorite, but I wasn't sure how to leave halfway into a service.The technician was nice enough, and I appreciated that she filed and buffed my nails and used cuticle oil since some other places literally just change your polish on a polish change.When I left, there were two different women at the front desk/cash register. Neither of them spoke to me - they spoke to each other, trying to figure out their computer system and how much I owed them. There's a huge menu on the wall, so I pointed at it and said, "It looks like I owe $8, right?" The woman nodded and opened the cash register. I gave her a $20 and asked for $10 back, which she silently gave me, and I walked out.Maybe they're still trying to get their feet under them and learn their systems, but customer service was pretty crummy and the ambiance leaves a little to be desired. There were a couple of other women getting pedicures/manicures, and one of them had wine (perk!) and the other was having all kinds of conversation with her technician, so maybe my experience was a one-off?
name: Blue Sky Nail Bar

text: The fella lives in Fort Mill, and I was in the market for a pedicure, so I found Tips & Toes thanks to Yelp. I stopped in after work on a Friday around 5:00, and the woman told me it would just be a few minutes while she finished up a manicure. I quickly realized she's a one-woman show, and it was good thing I got there when I did because they close at 6:00, and no one else had an appointment at 5:00.The pedicure was spot-on - massage chair, clean utensils, leg massage, heel scrub, $24 - and there was a small TV in the corner along with some magazines by the pedicure chairs. Conversation was great and helped pass the time; the pedicure took about 35-40 minutes. When I got home, I noticed there was a little polish on the skin around my big toe even though she was pretty thorough with using nail polish remover to get rid of an excess, but it was pretty easy to pick off myself. I had my work shoes on, and it was nice that she sold flip flops for $1! I just wore the pedicure flips out, but it was a nice touch. I'll be back, and I'll definitely make an appointment. And they do take credit cards... phew.

name: Tips & Toes

text: Lacquer Lounge is in the newly-developed (and still-being-developed) Kingsley neighborhood right across from Panera and Starbucks. Parking is a little tricky, but I went during lunch on a Friday, so it wasn't too hard to find a spot, and the place wasn't too busy.When I walked in, I was promptly greeted, and the man behind the counter asked what service I needed and if I wanted something to drink. I went with the Express Pedicure ($25) and a water, and when I asked about picking a color, he brought a basket over to me. Ok, y'all, I'm admittedly old school (and just old), but I like perusing the wall of bottles, flipping them over to see the name, and holding onto a couple before I make my final decision. Lacquer Lounge has a basket full of plastic nails painted in colors with a number on the back; you pick the color you like and I assume they match it up based on the number (gel or regular). This OCD lady had a bit of a panic moment - do they have OPI Koala Berry? what if I accidentally pick OPI Red because it looks good on the nail but definitely not on my pale, translucent skin? Thankfully, he saw my panic and asked what colors I usually get. I blurted out OPI Cajun Shrimp, and they had it. Phew.The rest of the pedicure was much less neurotic than the beginning. The woman who did it was incredibly nice and engaging when I wanted to talk but didn't force me to talk, which I appreciated. The Express Pedicure is definitely quick - I was in an out in less than 30 minutes - and not a bad price but still gives you the hot towel, shaping, and callus/cuticle removal. The place itself is spotless and brand new with air dryers built into the manicure stands and the massage controller built into the armrest on the pedicure chairs - fancy! According to their menu of services, they also do waxing, eyelash extensions, relaxation facial masks, and reflexology foot massages. And I was a walk-in, but I could see that having an appointment would be helpful during busy times. I'll definitely be back!

text: Located in what seems like the middle of nowhere is a walgreens that doesn't stay open 24 hours and the pharmacy had wicked hours of operation. I'm learning that Fort Mill is still the country which I'm fine with but I would love the walgreens to be open 24 hours. I did ask about the funky hours and the staff told me it's because there's not enough doctor offices in the area and the traffic isn't enough to warrant staying open all the time. Nonetheless I like coming here because everyone is friendly and ready to accommodate excellent customer service. If I want 24 hours I would have to drive to Rock Hill...no thanks.

text: Alexis is amazing! Over the years I have been to a few different massage therapists and she is by far the best. She is the only one in her office, so it is always quiet and her focus is on you. Most massages I've had feel great during, but then I leave basically feeling the same as when I walked in. With Alexis, this is not the case. She really listens to you and massages what you need her to, instead of other places where they just go thru their typical 30 min massage and kind of ignore whatever you tell them is bothering you (or at least that has been my experience ). She is a little pricey, which is probably the only thing that keeps me from going every week. Parking can be difficult - I always have to park across the street and cross Sage to get to her office. But it is definitely worth the money - trust me. Best massage therapist hands down.

text: Parking is a bit difficult but I was much less pleased with her attitude and  treatment towards me than anything else. We had a  misunderstanding about the massage I was requesting, which I was willing to let go, however she kept defending what she claimed to have said as opposed to just letting it go as a misunderstanding. Despite knowing I very specifically asked her twice (I had to ask her twice because what she was saying about extending the massage seemed to contradict her saying there was no need for it) if extending my massage time to 90 minutes from 60 minutes would allow the entire time for lymphatic massage and her answering yes I was willing to go with the flow. She did however offer to do the entire thing lymphatic. I agree, go to the bathroom, come back to fill out the paper work and she is being abrasively pushy about INSISTING I sit down instead of stand. It was just word and very hostile. I do sit down and mutter "wow" to myself.After this she did suggest we just not go through with it free of charge so I appreciate that as good business.  However I would've been much happier to have just been able to get a word in edge wise without feeling like she was talking down to me and defending what I had decided to chalk up to a misunderstanding. She made it a much bigger deal and worse experience than it needed to be by feeling the need to prove she was right.

text: I got into town early and needed a pedicure for my meeting and shoes for tomorrow.  The hotel recommended that I try Cameo (which has moved and is at 10 w. Mifflin St  phone 608-284-1956).  They were able to get me in for their last appointment, beginning at 8:15 pm.  I am so thrilled that they could.  I have a new home away from home spa! I lucked out and had Marina as my technician.  Despite it being the end of the day, Marina did not rush me.  I had a chance to chill in the quiet room before- great chaise lounges, crackling simulated fire going in the fireplace and relaxing music.  Once it was my turn, the good things kept coming!  They offer new massage chairs, and Aveda products.My feet are dancing with joy.  I had an outstanding paraffin pedicure- my toes have not looked better in a long time.  To top it off, I received coupons for my next visit- 10% off.  It was well worth the price (45$, but I think I got a special deal) and much less than I would have paid at home.  I am now working my schedule to make sure I have time to visit when I am back in town in a couple of weeks.THANKS CAMEO and Marina especially!  It was outstanding!

text: I am kind of surprised at the number of negative reviews. As is often the case, I feel the polar opposite. After moving to the Madison area and using a pay per go option at a local high school pool, I stopped here to check out memberships. To my surprise, a monthly membership (I chose the two-year plan) was less than what I was paying per month just to swim at the high school, with limited hours and access. And coming from the Chicago area, where a huge club like this one would cost twice as much as I'm paying, I am now happy to be using not only a non-crowded pool, but the adjacent sauna/steam/small resistance pool and "hanging out" area. Not to mention the 1/10th mile track and the plethora of exercise equipment. This will make winter in Madison  a lot more tolerable. I've had limited interaction with staff, nor have I taken classes. There is a great selection of those to choose from. And my interactions with the membership rep, Matt, were seamless, easy and quick.  . The Locker room facility is spacious and lockers are the real "adult" full length ones. All areas are kept very clean, as well. I'm really happy to have found this gym.
attributes: {'BusinessParking': {'garage': False, 'street': False, 'validated': False, 'lot': True, 'valet': False}, 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': True, 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': 2, 'BikeParking': True, 'AcceptsInsurance': True, 'GoodForKids': True, 'ByAppointmentOnly': False}
name: Princeton Club

text: My best friend is cooler than your best friend!  Why?  because she skipped the traditional bachelorette party nonsense, and instead, her whole bridal party got pampered.  I love pedicures.  My nail tech was super.  She spent a lot of time getting my nails perfect.  And the leg rubdown was awesome!I had my first ever manicure here and it was sooo relaxing.  My nails looked incredible!   I did the french manicure, and it did not make me look like a hooker.  It was extremely neat and very flattering.We should have investigated if they are byob or not.  We didn't bring anything, but it'd be something to ask about.   I mean, alcohol does make things entertaining, but the array of celebrity magazines kept me hooked.  (Snooki's baby is actually cute!)I can't comment on the cost of said services, bc my friend paid for all of us.  yup, she really is cooler than your bestie!

name: La Vie Nails & Spa

text: I love Aveda salons, so when I moved to Madison, I sought out one and ended up making Anaala my salon of choice. Easy appointment making online or by phone. Different levels of stylists at different prices for a haircut (typically for most Aveda salons). Stylists are usually punctual with appointment times. My old salon did a bit more in terms of services that accompanied a haircut (head massage, hand massage), but Anaala definitely meets the expectations of a great Aveda salon.

text: I had a great hair experience (hair-perience?) here. The staff here is very friendly and welcoming, and they also have a variety of complimentary beverages (alcoholic and non-alcoholic). So far, I've had two visits here...the first was a color consult with Jessica. I expressed my interest in bleaching all/part of my hair, and she talked me through the whole process and brought up issues that my hair might have after the process. After talking it through with her, I decided to go with some ombre instead of whole head bleaching. As I made an appointment, she advised me to bring in some looks next time, which I did. Since I have dark hair, it took me two appointments to bleach and tone my hair to the color I wanted, and Jessica even stayed way after the salon closed on the second appointment to finish my hair. I received a lot of compliments on my new ombre hair, so I would definitely recommend Jessica and Union Hair Parlor for your hair coloring needs! Also, there's a 10% discount if you have a Bicycle Benefits sticker :)

text: Vici is conveniently (for students, at least) located at 333 East Campus Mall. Their salon is upstairs and looks pretty nice. They have a wide range of Aveda hair products, as well as nail polish and makeup. As far as services go, I was satisfied with my haircut. It wasn't anything too complicated, just a trim, but it did take an hour. The head massage was nice but very brief. I also had a color service which was two foils. The color I asked for and the color I got were not the same, but I was satisfied with the result nonetheless. It did take twice as long as I was expecting, which was annoying.Summary: cheap, but will take a long time; also don't ask for anything too complicated.

text: Booked a haircut with Sadie through their online booking system, which was easy to use. Showed up on time, was not offered any beverages. Sadie was professional, but not very chatty. Wash, dry, cut all happened in about 40 minutes. Haircut turned out fine, but it was a really simple cut (long bob). I really like the products Thorps carries (Davines), but did not get a very welcoming overall vibe. Maybe I'm not cool enough? Bikers do receive a 10% off discount with their Bike Benefits sticker. Haircut prices are reasonable ($25-$30) but also depend on how much experience your stylist has. If you're looking to spend less money, take a gamble on their intern(s).

text: I had a 30 min massage appointment on Oct 11 with Kirsten Martin for muscle soreness and tension in my neck and shoulders, which I let her know about. During the massage, Kirsten used a lot of force to the point where it was very painful at times. I didn't speak up at the time because I thought this was normal, but speaking to colleagues and friends afterward about my experience, they told me that massage shouldn't be painful. I left last night feeling some relief from the muscle soreness and tension, but woke up this morning feeling worse. My neck, where she focused a lot of pressure, is tender to the touch and I am feeling soreness moving my neck around. I felt worse after the massage than I did going in.I emailed SolEscape with this information/feedback on Oct. 12 and they never responded.

name: SolEscape Healing Arts

text: 2 stars because the guy who did my Mom's mani/pedi was so patient and nice, but I can't see ever returning to this dimly lit salon at West Towne. Wayyy overpriced. Tired and grungy. And I tipped way too much because I always feel guilty for what shouldn't be a big deal -- mom is paralyzed on the left and can't move her own arm and leg on that side. A better nail salon would take it all in stride. My nail tech yawned and stretched the whole time, making me feel guilty for her being a nail tech. Not cool! I wanted to say "suck it up! I'm a nurse and you should try THAT for 12 hours!" It just felt unprofessional the whole time, and why would you pay $47 each for that? And that's for Mom not getting any polish and me only getting my toes polished! I'm dumb. But only once.

text: This place is super hip, so if that's not your thing....I've been here twice so far, and I'll keep coming. The staff is cool & laid back. The interior is pretty fun. I personally wouldn't bother with the buzz club on Fridays - it takes a lot of time, but they do a good job of course :).

text: Bath and Body works makes you smell like a gang of teenage prostitute, while L'Occitane makes you feel even poorer than you are, and Crabtree and Evelyn makes you feel you should only put their stuff out for overnight guests. And all three make guys feel like total pansies for being even within five feet of the doorway.Soap Opera is that happy medium, my friends.  It always smells good in there, but in a non-distracting, general way. They have a decent men's grooming section - razors, brushes, other manly grooming items - but more importantly, they have a lot of interesting toothpastes, soaps, and oils. It feels a little like an apothecary.They also have a lot of perfume oils you can buy, which you can then use as perfume, in lotions, in shampoo, as a room freshener, or what have you. You can blend your own scents or choose a pre-made one. The fig/moss scent is the best and I don't even wear fragrance.Service is always good. They're nice and helpful even if you have a dumb question. If you need a gift in a pinch, this is the place to go. Also if this is important to you, they're local.

text: I was quite overwhelmed with the amount of soap in this store. I'd hate to see the bubbly mess if the store was flooded. Whatever it is you are searching for it has to be in this store. It has many of your natural brands that can be hard to find in certain towns.
